DIRECTOR BIO: Manijeh Hekmat started her film career as a producer, and is now a prominent figure in Iranian cinema. Her films –including Women’s Prison (2002), Three Women (2007), and Bandar Band (2020) – have premiered at major international festivals such as Venice, Berlinale, and Toronto. A cinema student, Faeze Azizkhani participated in Abbas Kiarostami’s film workshops, and also benefited from his presence as the advisor for her debut feature film For a Rainy Day (2015). Her second feature film, The Locust (2022), was an official selection in festivals such as Karlovy Vary, SXSW, and Edinburgh Film Festival.
PRODUCER: Manijeh Hekmat, Amir Esfandiari, Ahmad Azizkhani
CAST: Amaneh Agharezakashi, Ahmad Azizkhani, Ghazal Ajdadi
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Manzar, a woman set in her rigid ways and beliefs, has been ostracized by her family and now ekes out a lonely existence. One day, she suddenly receives a call from her sister: her niece has been arrested for not wearing a hijab. Despite implorations from her family, Manzar sticks to her fundamentalist beliefs - her niece, an unbeliever, ought to be punished for the sin she’s committed. Finding herself all alone in a changing world, and increasingly racked by fear and guilt, Manzar begins to pray for heavenly deliverance.
TAGS: Films By Women, Social Impact, De/Gendered

DIRECTOR BIO: Turkish writer-director Belkis Bayrak received her MA degree in Film and Television from Istanbul Bilgi University. She founded her own production house Saba Film in 2018, and has so far made two short films, The Apartment (2018) and Cemile (2020). Bayrak is also an alumnus of the Torino Film Lab, Reclaim The Frame’s Filmonomics Program, and a member of the European Women’s Audio-visual (EWA) Network.
PRODUCER: Belkıs Bayrak, Murat Yaşar Bayrak, Mehmet Bahadır Er, Valmira Hyseni
CAST: Ecem Uzun, Bekir Behrem, Ernest Malazogu, Hakan Yufkacıgil
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Twenty-two-year-old Gülizar was raised in a loving albeit strict Turkish household full of taboos and expectations. Gulizar longs to experience what lies beyond the only world that she and the women around her have ever known. Betrothed to her beloved Emre, she is eager to leave everything behind and start a new life in Kosovo. Gülizar’s fairy tale, however, tragically turns into a nightmare when she is sexually assaulted en route. There’s seemingly little that can be done to obtain justice and, with wedding preparations in full swing, Gülizar’s aspirations for happiness appears bleak and distant. But secrets are hard to keep in close-knit societies. Told through the gaze of a woman yearning for her own internal locus of control, Gülizar delves into the complexities of trauma, societal expectations, and the universal search for self-discovery and determination.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Toronto International Film Festival 2024, San Sebastián International Film Festival 2024
TAGS: Films By Women, Social Impact, De/Gendered

DIRECTOR BIO: Louise Courvoisier is a French director who grew up in Cressia in the Petite Montagne region, in a home where all forms of art rubbed shoulders with nature and rurality. Her graduation short, Mano A Mano (2019), won the first prize at the Cinéfondation at Cannes IFF. Holy Cow is her debut feature.
CAST: Clément Faveau, Luna Garret, Mathis Bernard, Dimitry Baudry, Maïwene Barthelemy
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Totone, 18 years old, spends most of his time drinking beers and partying in the Jura region with his group of friends. But reality catches up with him: he has to take care of his 7-year-old sister and find a way to make a living. He then sets out to make the best Comté cheese in the region, one that would win him the gold medal at the agricultural competition and help him get 30,000 euros. Featuring authentic performances from its adolescent non-actors, Holy Cow is filled with emotional ups and downs, including the euphoria of first love and the power of boyhood friendships.
AWARDS: Youth Award, Cannes Film Festival 2024
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Cannes Film Festival 2024, Karlovy Vary International Film Festival 2024, Vancouver International Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Born in Madrid in 1967, Iciar Bollaín began her career in the world of cinema as an actress, before gradually foraying into film direction. She went on to direct one of her biggest hits Take My Eyes (2003), winner of Goya Awards for Best Director and Best Screenplay at Spain’s national film awards. Her work as a filmmaker is characterised by a commitment to major issues such as domestic violence (Take my Eyes), the Basque question (Maixabel) or the water war in Bolivia (Even the Rain).
PRODUCER: Koldo Zuazua, Guillermo Sempere, Juan Moreno
CAST: Mireia Oriol, Urko Olazábal, Ricardo Gómez, Carlos Serrano, Lucía Veiga
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Soy Nevenka dramatises the case of Nevenka Fernández, a member of the Ponferrada City Council who in 2001 became the first woman in Spain to win a court case for sexual harassment against a high-ranking politician – her ex boyfriend and all-powerful Ponferrada mayor Ismael Alvárez. Relentlessly hounded by the mayor, a man used to getting his way both politically and personally, a twenty-three year old Nevenka decides to report him, knowing fully well that it will cost her dearly. What follows is a gripping and intense drama that tells the story of a pioneer of the Spanish MeToo movement.
AWARDS: Euskadi Basque Country 2030 Agenda Award, San Sebastian International Film Festival 2024
FESTIVAL HISTORY: San Sebastián International Film Festival 2024, BFI London Film Festival 2024,Hamburg Film Festival, 2024, Zurich Film Festival, 2024

TAGS: Films By Women, Historical, Social Impact, De/Gendered

DIRECTOR BIO: A Georgian-American filmmaker, George Sikharulidze holds a B.S. in Media Communications from New York University and an M.F.A. in Film Directing from Columbia University. His short films –The Fish that Drowned (2014), Red Apples (2016), A New Year (2018) and Fatherland (2019)– have premiered at renowned festivals such as Toronto International Film Festival and Sundance Film Festival. His first feature project Panopticon was selected at the Cinéfondation Residence of Cannes Film Festival as well as the Torino Script Lab (2019). Apart from writing and directing, George is a professor of filmmaking at Tisch School of the Arts.
CAST: Data Chachua, Ia Sukhitashvili, Vakho Kedeladze, Vakhtang Kedeladze, Salome Gelenidze, Marita Meskhoradze, Andro Japaridze, Malkhaz Abuladze
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: When Sandro’s father decides to devote his existence to God and leaves for a monastery, the introverted teenager finds himself deprived of the fundamental certainties of life. Alone and abandoned during his formative years - with a mother illegally working abroad and a grandmother too old to substitute a parent - Sandro embarks on a dizzying journey of self-discovery, opening up both to a new friendship with the right-wing radical Lasha and also to the chance to explore his burgeoning sexuality, a trial that will eventually prove to be a revelation of his humanity.
AWARDS: Ecumenical Jury Commendation - Karlovy Vary 2024
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Karlovy Vary International Film Festival 2024, Palić European Film Festival 2024
LINK TRAILER: Panopticon (Trailer) - Giffoni Film Festival 2024 - Generator +18 - YouTube

DIRECTOR BIO: A former National Fencer for Singapore, Nelicia graduated in 2018 with an MFA in Film Directing from Columbia University in New York. Her short film Freeze, about her relationship with her autistic brother, premiered at the 38th Clermont-Ferrand international Short Film Festival in 2016 and went on to screen at over 70 festivals around the world. She was previously selected for the 2018 Singapore IFF’s Southeast Asian Film Lab and the 2019 Less is More European film lab, and was chosen for the New Waves: Emerging Voices of Southeast Asia director showcase in 2017. Pierce is her debut feature.
PRODUCER: Sam Chua Weishi, Jeremy Chua, Patrick Mao Huang, Izabela Igel, John M. Lo
CAST: Ding Ning , Tsao Yu-Ning, Liu Hsiu-Fu, Lin Tsu-Heng
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: High school fencer Zijie’s older brother Zihan is being released early from juvenile prison, where he has served seven years for killing an opponent in a fencing match. Zihan vehemently insists on his innocence, and, behind their mother’s back, the torn brotherly bond gradually begins to heal as Zihan helps Jie perfect his fencing skills. But the initially energetic clinking of sabres is slowly drowned out by silent doubts: is Zihan really innocent? Nelicia Low’s gripping and atmospheric directorial debut offers a nerve-wracking duel between the ideals of brotherly love and the illusions that we project onto those close to us.
AWARDS: Best Director, Karlovy Vary International Festival 2024
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Karlovy Vary International Film Festival 2024, Busan International Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: A theatre and cinema director from Tunisia, Lotfi Achour has directed more than twenty-five theatrical productions in the UK, France, and Tunisia. He has also directed three short films, including La Laine sur le dos (2016), which was nominated in the Short Film Category at the 69th Cannes International Film Festival.
PRODUCER: Anissa Daoud, Sébastien Hussenot, Lotfi Achour
CAST: Ali Helali, Yassine Samouni, Wided Dabebi, Jemii Lamari, Latifa Gafsi
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Mghila Mountain, Tunisia, November 2015. Two young shepherds, Nizar and Achraf, are grazing their cattle in a secluded meadow, unaware of its status as a militarised zone. A sudden encounter with a group of jihadists results in a horrifying act of violence. Traumatized and reeling from the encounter, Achraf carries his terrible burden down the mountain, where he will be confronted by the helplessness of his elders, themselves forsaken by the authorities. Inspired by real events and deeply rooted in a ruthless social context, Red Path is a dreamlike journey into the wounded psyche of a child and his incredible ability to overcome trauma.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Locarno International Film Festival 2024, Vancouver International Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: One of the leading figures of new Quebec cinema, Sophie Deraspea fell in love with cinema during her Visual Arts studies in Austria and Literature studies at the University of Ottawa and Montreal. Her feature films and documentaries have been screened and won awards at major international festivals. Her 2019 film Antigone won Best Canadian Feature at the Toronto International Film Festival, and was also chosen to represent Canada at the Oscars.
PRODUCER: Kim McCraw, Luc Déry, Élaine Hébert, Caroline Bonmarchand, Xenia Sulyma
CAST: Félix-Antoine Duval, Solène Rigot, Guilaine Londez, Michel Benizri, David Ayala, Véronique Ruggia Saura, Younès Boucif
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Following a medical wake-up call, Montréal copywriter Mathyas Lefebure abandons his life in Canada to reinvent himself as a sheep herder in the French Alps, despite knowing literally nothing about the centuries-old craft. Ever the romantic, he is clouded by bucolic visions and dreams of writing a book in untroubled pastoral repose. What he finds is very different: the brutal life-and-death realities of sheep farming and the viciousness and cruelty of isolated men. After a rough start, he’s joined by Élise, a civil servant tempted by his stories of pastoral life, and together they commit to a summer on the mountainside. Just the two of them. And one border collie. And 800 sheep. Adapted from a semi-autobiographical novel by Mathyas Lefebure and set in the breathtaking French Alps, Shepherds is an epic of personal growth, posing tough questions about how best to live in order to feel free.
AWARDS: Best Canadian Feature Film Award, Toronto International Film Festival 2024
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Toronto International Film Festival 2024, Vancouver International Film Festival 2024

TITLE ENGLISH: The New Year That Never Came
DIRECTOR BIO: Bogdan Muresanu shifted from literature and advertising to screenwriting when he won the HBO TIFF Scriptwriting Competition for the short script The Human Touch (2008). He is best known as the scriptwriter of Sandals, a short animated film that won numerous international awards, including the Youth Jury Award at Clermont-Ferrand in 2020. He is also known for his short film The Christmas Gift, winner of the European Film Academy Award for Best Short Film 2019.
CAST: Adrian Vancica, Nicoleta Hâncu, Emilia Dobrin, Iulian Postelnicu, Mihai Cǎlin, Andrei Miercure
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: December 20th 1989. After decades of all-pervasive oppression under the brutal Ceaușescu dictatorship, Romania stands on the brink of revolution. The streets are alive with demonstrations; students mock the regime through art, while official New Year’s shows glorify Ceausescu. Behind closed doors, families grapple with personal conflicts and the omnipresent Secret Police. Over the course of a single day, six seemingly unconnected lives intersect in unexpected ways, mapping out the painful absurdities of lives governed both by fear and hopeful glimpses of a better future. As tensions reach a boiling point, an explosive moment brings them together, culminating in the dramatic fall of Ceausescu and the communist regime.
AWARDS: Orizzonti Award for Best Film, and Special Mention: Authors Under 40 Award, Venice International Film Festival 2024
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Venice International Film Festival 2024, Vancouver International Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Film director and screenwriter Saulė Bliuvaitė graduated from the Lithuanian Academy of Music and Theatre’s Film Directing program in 2018. Her short film Limousine (2021) received the Best Short Documentary award at the Warsaw Film Festival. Saule is also the co-writer and co-editor of the historical drama Isaac, nominated for a FIPRESCI prize at the 2020 European Film Awards. Toxic is her debut feature.
CAST: Vesta Matulytė, Ieva Rupeikaitė, Giedrius Savickas, Vilma Raubaitė, Eglė Gabrėnaitė
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Abandoned by her mother, thirteen-year-old Marija has trouble fitting into the gray industrial town where she now lives with her grandmother. She begins to form a tentative and volatile bond with rebellious peer Kristina, and the two enroll in a local modeling school that promises its pupils the chance of a glamorous life far away from their bleak and isolated existence. But the financial and physical demands of the school force them to come up with increasingly extreme and dangerous ways to conform their young bodies to impossible standards of beauty. An aptly titled coming-of-age tale set amidst contaminated physical and social landscapes, Toxic has at its centre an exploration of the human body in all its frailty and glory.
AWARDS: Golden Leopard, and Swatch First Feature Award, Ecumenical Jury Prize, Locarno International Film Festival 2024
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Locarno International Film Festival 2024, Vancouver International Film Festival 2024, Chicago International Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Jiri Madl is a Czech actor, scriptwriter and director. He graduated from the University of J. A. Comenius, and subsequently studied screenwriting at the New York Film Academy. He is the youngest actor to win a Crystal Globe for Best Actor In The Leading Role at the Karlovy Vary International Film Festival. Waves (Viny) is Madl’s third feature film, and has been selected as the Czech Republic's official entry for Best International Feature Film at the 97th Academy Awards.
CAST: Vojtěch Vodochodsky, Tatiana Pauhofová, Vojtěch Kotek, Stanislav Majer, Martin Hofmann, Petr Lněnička
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Inspired by the true story of a group of journalists from the International Life Department of Czechoslovak Radio who risked everything to provide independent news coverage during the turbulent year of 1968, when Soviet troops invaded Czechoslovakia under the guise of “brotherly assistance.” Epic in both length and scope, Waves embraces defiance and heroism in the face of an oppressive regime, and champions the eternal themes of love, morality, and hope.
AWARDS: Audience Award, Karlovy Vary Film Festival 2024
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Karlovy Vary International Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Meryam Joobeur believes wholeheartedly in the transformative power of storytelling and hopes that her films can capture the beauty, complexity and universal nature of the human condition. Her short films Gods, Weeds and Revolutions (2012) and Born in the Maelstrom (2017) have been screened internationally, and her Oscar nominated short Brotherhood (2018) was screened at more than 150 festivals and also won 75 international prizes.
PRODUCER: Nadim Cheikhrouha, Sarra Ben Hassen, Annick Blanc, Maria Gracia Turgeon, Meryam Joobeur
CAST: Salha Nasraoui, Mohamed Hassine Grayaa, Malek Mechergui, Adam Bessa, Dea Liane, Rayen Mechergui, Chaker Mechergui
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: On a farm in the remote north of Tunisia, Aïcha lives with her husband Brahim and their youngest child Adam. Gifted with dreams that foretell the future, she is racked with anguish after her other sons Mehdi and Amine leave to fight for ISIS in a violent conflict in Syria. When Mehdi returns home with a mysterious and pregnant wife in tow, the village is turned upside down in a series of unsettling events. Aïcha now finds herself torn between her love for her son and her need to face the turmoil gripping the community. Meryam Joobeur’s haunting debut feature weaves together elements of macabre mystery, political provocation and supernatural suspense to offer a distinctive female take on traditional masculine themes of war and radicalisation.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Berlin International Film Festival 2024, Karlovy Vary International Film Festival 2024, Hong Kong International Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Blessy debuted with his first film Kaazhcha, a film that became a turning point in Malayalam cinema history. He is the winner of 6 state awards, 3 filmfare awards and a national award, and has made films that have been critically acclaimed and also done well at the box office. His ‘100 years of Chrysostom A Biographical Film’ holds the guinness world record for longest documentary.
CAST: Prithviraj Sukumaran
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Some men’s destinies are written by others. The Goat Life is the true-life story of Najib, a man who leaves behind his wife, mother and his unborn child, and goes from the lush green lands of Kerala, India – famously referred to as ‘God’s Own Country’ - to a barren desert country in the middle-East in search of a better life, a better future. In this leap into the unknown, Najib is forced into hard labour on a goat farm, in the process losing all hope and his very sense of identity. Aadujeevitham is the touching story of his painful acceptance of that life, and his almost miraculous escape from an impossible situation. It is the touching story of one man that at once also highlights the plight of a million.

DIRECTOR BIO: Aditya has made significant contributions to both Marathi and Hindi cinema. His debut short film, Aaba Aiktaay Naa?, won the National Award for Best Direction at the 64th National Film Awards. His second short, Kharvas, opened the Indian Panorama at IFFI 2018 and earned him a second National Award in 2019. Aditya’s feature debut, Article 370, starring Yami Gautam and Priyamani, was a critically acclaimed blockbuster. Currently, he's working on Baramulla, a supernatural thriller produced by B62 Studios and Jio Studios. Aditya is passionate about creating impactful, emotionally resonant films that captivate audiences.

LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: In the aftermath of the 2016 Kashmir unrest, a young local field agent, Zooni Haksar, is picked out by Rajeshwari Swaminathan from the Prime Minister's Office for a top-secret mission. Their aim? Cracking down on terrorism and putting an end to the billion-dollar conflict economy in the valley, by doing the absolute impossible - Abrogating the notorious Article 370. That too, without spilling a single drop of innocent blood.

His latest film, Godavari (2021), won two awards at the International Film Festival India Goa, making it the first Marathi film in history to win two awards at a major international film festival. Godavari also earned Nikhil the coveted Suvarna Kamal for Best Direction at the National Film Awards in 2022.

LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: In the heart of the forest, a timeless battle brews between greed and preservation, capitalism and conservation. Brave officers face off against a ruthless mafia in a struggle that transcends human conflict. But as the jungle's very soul hangs in the balance, will they stand united to protect the delicate harmony between humanity and wildlife? The Tiger (Raavsaaheb) tells the story of the man-animal conflict between tribals and the tiger from the perspectives of various uniformed and non-uniformed civilians - all fighting against a system built seamlessly to ensure that the environment will always suffer. It is also a revenge film where multiple protagonists fight for justice for a tribal girl and in the process end up uncovering a much bigger, much more sinister truth.

DIRECTOR BIO: Marcelo Botta has explored storytelling cultures in over 20 countries in regions including the Amazon, Patagonia, the Andes, the Atacama Desert and the Caribbean. His debut feature, Betânia, participated in the First Cut session of Ventana Sur 2022 and won three post-production prizes. He has created and directed documentary and fiction series for Paramount+, MTV, and FOX.

In the wake of her husband’s death, Betânia is forced to move back to the village where she was born, leaving behind a lifetime of memories. Pushed by the ancestral sounds of Maranhão, Betânia and her family fight to maintain balance and a sense of identity as tradition and modernity collide.

Forced to beg for stale and rotten food every day, little Jotya has to make do with the smell of fresh food, something he has grown to cherish. While his pregnant mother struggles to make ends meet, Jotya becomes obsessed with a particular smell, a smell that will forever change his life.

LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: 28-year-old homemaker Saraswathi and her husband Prasad, a bus conductor, live with their sons Arun and Varun in a modest home near the Tirupati temple. At 16, Saraswathi chose marriage over education, and her lack of formal schooling becomes a challenge when Arun struggles with his math homework. The situation worsens when Arun is suspended from school and asked to take a gap year. Overwhelmed, Arun tries to run away but is luckily found by Saraswathi's friend. Determined to help her son, Saraswathi begins learning math herself, a decision that will lead to significant personal and academic milestones. A film that underscores the power of perseverance, family support, and community intervention in overcoming adversity.

DIRECTOR BIO: Levan Akin's work explores class, gender and sexuality, across a range of forms. He is most known for And Then We Danced (2019) which premiered in the Quinzaine des Réalisateurs at the Cannes Film Festival and was Sweden’s official entry for the Oscars. He had directed the TV series, Real Humans (2012) and the series adaptation of American gothic horror Interview with the Vampire (2022-24).
CAST: Mzia Arabuli, Lucas Kankava, Deniz Dumanlı
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Lia, a retired teacher, made a promise to find her long lost niece Tekla. The search takes her to Istanbul, a beautiful city that seems full of connections and possibilities. There she meets Evrim, a lawyer fighting for trans rights, and Tekla starts to feel closer than ever. Two initially hesitant strangers overcome not only ideological but also internal boundaries on their mission and join forces.
AWARDS: Teddy Jury Award, Berlin International Film Festival 2024
FESTIVAL HISTORY:
Tribeca Film Festival 2024, Karlovy Vary International Film Festival 2024,
Sarajevo Film Festival, 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Iman Yazdi began his career as an Assistant Director in 2006 and later worked as a Line Producer and Executive Producer. His directorial works include the short films Homeless (2014), First Exit (2012), and After the Game (2011). For Rana is his first feature film.
CAST: Hamed Behdad, Pantea Panahiha
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Aref lives with his wife and their daughter Rana. He intends to break the world record for the motorcycle ramp jump, but gets entangled in family events that put him in a dilemma.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Busan International Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: He studied at the University of Theatre and Film Arts in Budapest. His short film Itt vagyok (2010) was screened in Cannes' Cinéfondation and nominated for Best Short Film at the European Film Awards. Fekete pont is his feature fiction debut.
CAST: Paul Mátis, Anna Mészöly, Ákos 'Dadan' Kovács, Inez Mátis, Gábor Ferenczi
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Young teacher Juci attempts to challenge the outdated methods in her school, while new student Palkó, recently relocated from abroad, struggles to adapt to the demanding educational system. Their personal stories offer insight into an oppressive system, reflecting the broader Hungarian society.
AWARDS: Pardo for Best Performance, Special Mention, Concorso Cineasti del Presente, Locarno Film Festival 2024
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Locarno International Film Festival 2024

At the age of 11, like all
Cambodians, Rithy Panh was
interned in Khmer Rouge camps
for rehabilitation through
labor. He moved to France,
and in 1985 entered the IDHEC
film school. His filmography
includes Irradiated (2020,
Berlinale – Golden Bear for Best
Documentary), The Missing
Picture (2013, Festival de
Cannes – Un Certain Regard,
Winner of Best Film; Oscar
2014, Nominee, Best Foreign
Language Film) among others.

SCREENPLAY: Catherine Dussart, Rithy Panh, Justine O., Roger Huang, Fatma Hassan Alremaihi, Hanaa Issa, Mehmet Zahid Sobaci, Muhammed Ziyad Varol, Mirsad Purivatra, Jovan Marjanović, Georges-Marc Benamou
CAST: Irène Jacob, Grégoire Colin, Cyril Guei, Bunhok Lim, Somaline Mao
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Democratic Kampuchea (Cambodia),1978. Three French journalists are invited by the Khmer Rouge to conduct an exclusive interview of the regime’s leader, Pol Pot. The country seems ideal. But behind the Potemkin village, the Khmer Rouge regime is declining and the war with Vietnam threatens to invade the country. The regime is looking for culprits, secretly carrying out a large scale genocide. Under the eyes of the journalists, the beautiful picture cracks, revealing the horror within. Freely inspired by journalist Elizabeth Becker’s account in When The War Was Over.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Cannes Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Joshua Trigg has worked the last decade mostly across Asia. He is known for his storytelling, high-end TV commercials and award-winning narrative and documentary. Satu - Year of the Rabbit is his debut feature film.
CAST: Itthiphone Sonepho, Vanthiva Saysana
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Bo, a Laotian teenager with an abusive father, wants to study journalism at the University of Hanoi, Vietnam. As part of the application, she needs to send in a photojournalistic piece. Inspired by a project that could see her escape grimness, she sets off on a journey that takes her to the Pha Tang Temple, where she meets the young orphan Satu, taken in as a baby by the head monk. As the village tries to sort out the problem of unexploded bombs unearthed by floods, Bo agrees to head north with Satu in search of his mother – Satu hoping to find answers, Bo looking to carve out a story.
AWARDS: Best Debut Director, Raindance Film Festival 2024 I South East Asia Winner, Cambodia International Film Festival 2024
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Raindance Film Festival 2024, Cambodia International Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Pia Marais is a writer and director from South Africa and Sweden. She has written and directed three feature films. Her feature debut, The Unpolished (2007), won the Tiger Award at the Rotterdam Film Festival; Im Alter von Ellen (2010) screened in competition at Locarno and at more than 30 festivals, including TIFF. Layla Fourie (2013) premiered in competition at the Berlinale, receiving a Special Jury Mention. Transamazonia is her fourth feature film.
PRODUCER: Pia Marais, Martin Rosefeldt, Willem Droste
SCREENPLAY: Pia Marais, Martin Rosefeldt, Willem Droste
CAST: Helena Zengel, Jeremy Xido, Joao Vitor Xavante, Pira Assurini, Hama Vieira, Sabine Timoteo
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Rebecca, the daughter of missionary Lawrence Byrne, was declared a “miracle” after she survived a plane crash as a child, deep in the Amazon forest. Years later, Rebecca has become a miracle healer, sustaining their mission thanks to her growing fame. But when illegal loggers invade the land belonging to the indigenous people they’re evangelizing, Rebecca’s father maneuvers them into the epicenter of this escalating conflict.
FESTIVAL HISTORY:
Locarno Film Festival, 2024, Toronto International Film Festival 2024,
New York Film Festival 2024
LINK TRAILER: Transamazonia (2024) | Pia Marais | OFFICIAL TRAILER - YouTube

DIRECTOR BIO: Unsinkable is director Christian Andersen’s second feature. His first feature was the thriller None Shall Sleep (2019). Unsinkable is a personal film project inspired by the real RF2 accident in 1981, Northern Denmark.
CAST: Sylvester Byder, Johanne Louise Schmidt, Anders Brinck, Ellen Rovsing Knudsen, Sofie Torp, Lars Topp, Henrik Birch, Esben Dalgaard, Iben Dorner
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: In 1981, the newly built and supposedly unsinkable rescue boat RF2 tragically sank during one of its initial rescue missions, resulting in the loss of nine lives. Henrik, the son of RF2's captain, initiates an investigation as his father is held responsible for the accident. However, he encounters resistance from the town's fishermen, who are concerned about potential job losses, as well as the authorities, who fear a public scandal. Meanwhile, grief looms over Henrik's family, threatening to tear them apart. A film inspired by true events.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Bodil Awards 2024

Shiboprosad, also a writer and

LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Aamar Boss is about a 40-year-old man, Animesh, who runs a publishing house. He is estranged from his wife, who is busy pursuing her career in Mumbai. His mother, Shubhra Goswami, a retired head nurse, has recently undergone a major heart operation and is recuperating at home. Bored, Shubhra decides to accompany her son to his office and work as an intern there, much to her son's dissatisfaction, a decision that will irreversibly change the dynamics of the company and the lives of its employees.

Jadumoni Dutta is a film
and theater personality and
award-winning actor from
Assam. He has to his credit
films like Agnisakshi, Paani,
Jetuka Pator Dare. He received
the National Award for CSR and
Sustainability for the TV series
Kuwoli. He was in the jury for
many prestigious film festivals
as a nominated member of the
FTII of India, Pune.

Jadumoni Dutta
rita Dutta
nandini Sharma Dutta

LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Juiphool (Orange and Purple) Juiphool is a tale of two mothers from the conflict-ridden Assam-Nagaland border area, where the daily routine of the villagers of Naragaon has radically altered: vigilance at night,and rest during the day. Set against such a backdrop, the film follows Lakhimi, a pregnant Assamese widow, who develops a secret bond with a Naga woman, Rengma, who has suffered repeated miscarriages. As their bond grows stronger, the villagers get suspicious about Lakhimi ‘s secret relationship and hatch a plan to catch her red-handed. Meanwhile, an Assamese folk tale -Tula Aru Teja - with a similar storyline flows along through the voices of Gita and her mother -the victims of violent border conflicts.

DIRECTOR BIO: Tushar Hiranandani is an Indian film director and screenwriter. He has written films like Masti (2004), Atithi Tum Kab Jaoge? (2010), Housefull 2 (2012), ABCD: Any Body Can Dance (2013), Ek Villain (2014), Dishoom (2016) and Half Girlfriend (2017) among others. He then made his directorial debut with Saand Ki Aankh (2019) and went onto make Srikanth (2024). In 2023, he directed the Sony LIV series Scam 2003.
CAST:
Rajkummar Rao,
Alaya F
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: In a world with the odds stacked against him every step of the way, Srikanth defies norms, blazing a trail straight from rural India to becoming the first visually impaired student at MIT. As he builds Bollant Industries, his success brings challenges, each of which he conquers not only to chase personal dreams but also to safeguard a shared future for the ones just like him. A biopic chronicling the life of industrialist Srikanth Bolla, Srikanth is the tale of an entrepreneur’s triumph and sacrifice, both of which he welcomed with open arms and a smile.

DIRECTOR BIO: Guan Ho is a sixth-generation Chinese filmmaker. A prolific producer and director, he is known for Mr. Six (2015), The Eight Hundred (2020), and most recently Black Dog (2024), which has added to his list of accolades with the coveted Un Certain Regard.
SCREENPLAY: Rui Ge, Guan Hu, Wu Bing
CAST: Eddie Peng, Jia Zhang-ke, Tong Liya
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: On the edge of the Gobi desert in Northwest China, Lang returns to his hometown after being released from jail. While working for the local dog patrol team to clear the town of stray dogs before the Olympic Games, he strikes up an unlikely connection with a black dog. These two lonely souls now embark on a new journey together.
AWARDS: Un Certain Regard, Cannes Film Festival 2024 I Crème de la Crème Award, Warsaw International Film Festival 2024
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Cannes Film Festival 2024, Warsaw International Film Festival 2024, Edinburgh International Film Festival 2024, American Film Institute Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: A filmmaker from Australia, Jaydon Martin worked as a camera operator for narrative and documentary features before becoming a director. His experience growing up in a low-socioeconomic area of Australia drives him to explore maligned cultures and working class expressions in his projects. Flathead (2024) is his directorial debut.
CAST: Cass Cumerford, Andrew Wong
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Cass Cumerford has borne more than his fair share of setbacks in life. Now in his seventies, he decides to return to his childhood home of Bundaberg, a small city famous for its rum, in Queensland. Through conversations with the strangers he encounters and the friends he makes, Cass gradually reveals the events that have shaped his life – the mistakes he has made, the moments of joy and the grief that weigh him down. Drawing on the lives and pasts of a rich panoply of characters in Bundaberg, Flatlead revels in the fabric of everyday lives, while dealing with subjects that range from addiction and race to faith and the forces that bind and repel us.
AWARDS: Tiger Competition Special Jury Award, International Film Festival Rotterdam 2024
FESTIVAL HISTORY: International Film Festival Rotterdam 2024, Sydney International Film Festival 2024

LANGUAGE: Portuguese, Chinese, Thai, French, Burmese, Vietnamese, Filipino, Japanese
DIRECTOR BIO: Miguel Gomes lives and works in Lisbon, Portugal. After starting his career as a film critic, Miguel Gomes directed a series of short films, followed by his first feature film in 2004, La Gueule que tu mérites. His fame grew internationally in 2012 with his film Tabu, which won the Alfred Bauer Prize at the Berlin Film Festival. Two years later, his ambitious trilogy of The Arabian Nights transposed thr structure and form of the tale with acerbic irony to contemporary Portugal. Drawing on popular imaginaries, his works are marked by the blurring of documentary and fiction that defines his style as a whole.
SCREENPLAY: Mariana Ricardo, Telmo Churro, Maureen Fazendeiro, Miguel Gomes
DOP: Rui Poças, Sayombhu Mukdeeprom, Gui Liang
CAST: Gonçalo Waddington, Crista Alfaiate, Cláudio da Silva, Lang Khê Tran
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: In 1917, British diplomat Edward is stationed in Burma and travels by train from Rangoon to Mandalay, where Molly, his fiancée of seven years, is finally arriving to join him. But before her steamship can dock, Edward loses his nerve and flees on the next boat to Singapore. This doesn’t deter the exuberant Molly, who promptly sets off after her cowardly bridegroom. He leads Molly on a chase through Bangkok, Saigon, Manila, Osaka, Shanghai, Chongqing, Chengdu and onwards – even through history, transcending storytelling itself. This stunning cinematic essay on place and memory is much grander in scope than Edward and Molly’s journey; it demands to be experienced moment to moment.
AWARDS:
Winner: Best Director, Cannes Film Festival
2024
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Cannes Film Festival 2024, Toronto International Film Festival 2024, BFI London Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Scandar Copti is a Palestinian filmmaker and visual artist, originally from Yafa, now based in Abu Dhabi. His debut feature film, Ajami (co-directed with Yaron Shani), won the Camera d'Or Special Mention at the Cannes Film Festival and was nominated for Best Foreign Language Film at the 82nd Academy Awards. Copti is also the recipient of the prestigious Sutherland Trophy and the Council of Europe Film Award. Happy Holidays (2024) is his latest film.
PRODUCER: Tony Copti, Jiries Copti, Dorothe Beinemeier, Jean Bréhat, Marco Valerio Fusco, Micaela Fusco
CAST: Manar Shehab, Wafaa Aoun, Toufic Danial, Meirav Memoresky
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Four interconnected characters share their unique realities, highlighting the complexities between genders, generations, and cultures. Rami, a Palestinian from Haifa, is dealing with his Jewish girlfriend’s sudden change of heart about her planned abortion. His mother, Hanan, is facing a financial crisis and becomes entangled in complications while seeking compensation for her daughter’s Fifi accident. Miri is forced to confront her daughter’s depression while also working to undermine her sister’s pregnancy with Rami. Fifi grapples with the guilt of hiding a secret that risks her family’s reputation and her burgeoning relationship with Dr. Walid. In this panoramic family drama from Oscar-nominated Palestinian director Scandar Copti, a ruinous mixture of personal quests, poor choices, and intractable social pressures test the stamina of cherished relationships, both well-worn and still blooming.
AWARDS: Orizzonti Award for Best Screenplay, Venice Film Festival 2024
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Venice Film Festival 2024, Toronto International Film Festival 2024
TAGS: Social Impact, Global Politics, Festival Hits

DIRECTOR BIO: A graduate of both the London Film School and the Film and Television School of Performing Arts in Prague (FAMU), Lilja Ingolfsdottir has written and directed around 20 short and mid length films that have been shown at prestigious festivals and been distributed both nationally and internationally. Loveable is her debut feature.
CAST: Helga Guren, Oddgeir Thune, Elisabeth Sand
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Years after a whirlwind romance leads to her second marriage, Maria finds herself lost and confused amid her busy life when her husband says he wants a divorce. As she struggles to understand what went wrong, everyone around her - her ex, her children, and even her mother – gives her the impression that she was the cause. Featuring an outstanding and vulnerable performance from Guren, Lilja Ingolfsdottir’s debut feature takes a fresh and nuanced approach to contemporary ideas of romance, relationship equality, and the power of womanhood.
AWARDS: Winner: Crystal Globe Special Jury Prize - Kalovy Vary International Film Festival 2024
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Kalovy Vary International Film Festival 2024
TAGS: Social Impact, De/Gendered, Films By Women, Festival Hits

DIRECTOR BIO: Kurdwin Ayub, born in 1990 in Iraq, is a filmmaker and artist based in Vienna. Her first fictional feature film, Sonne (2022), premiered at the 2022 Berlinale in the Encounters competition and won the Best First Feature Award. She was also nominated for European Discovery at the 35th European Film Awards.
CAST: Florentina Holzinger, Andria Tayeh, Celina Antwan, Nagham Abu Baker
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Former martial artist Sarah leaves Austria to train three sisters from a wealthy Jordanian family. What initially sounds like a dream job soon becomes unsettling: the young women are cut off from the outside world and under constant surveillance. The sport doesn’t seem to interest them. So why has Sarah been hired?
AWARDS: Winner: Special Jury Prize, and Special Mention: Ecumenical Prize, Locarno Film Festival 2024
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Locarno International Film Festival 2024
LINK TRAILER: Mond | Trailer | Film Fest Gent 2024 - YouTube

DIRECTOR BIO: Tawfik Alzaidi is a Saudi director, based in Riyadh, who is considered to be a leading and influential member of the new cinema wave in Saudi Arabia. Tawfik began directing his own short films in 2006. His first short film The Fabricated Crime won best editing in the Jeddah Film Festival in 2007, and his film The Silence won the Gulf Short Film Award in the Muscat International Film Festival 2009. Norah is his debut feature.
CAST: Yaqoub Alfarhan, Maria Bahrawi, Abdullah Alsadhan
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Nader, a new schoolteacher and a closeted artist, arrives at a small and remote Saudi Arabian village. There, he meets Norah, a young woman who ignites the creativity inside him and inspires him to paint again. At great risk, they develop a delicate connection and a quiet bond. Nader enlightens Norah on the wider world outside of her tiny community, and Norah realizes that she must leave to find a place where she can be free to express her true artistic self. Set in the 90s when artistic expression was banned, Norah is a deeply moving story about the basic human need to communicate through art.
AWARDS: Special Mention (Un Certain Regard), Cannes Film Festival 2024
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Cannes Film Festival 2024, Melbourne International Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Nelson Carlo De Los Santos Arias studied cinematography in Buenos Aires and at Edinburgh College of Art. He then received his MFA in Film and Video from CalArts. His thesis, the feature-length essay film Santa Teresa & Other Stories (2015) had its world premiere at FIDMarseille. The film won the Prix Georges de Beauregard, after which it was selected at many other film festivals. De Los Santos Arias’ feature film Cocote (2017) was crowned Best Film in the Signs of Life section of the Locarno International Film Festival.
PRODUCER: Pablo Lozano, Tanya Valette, Nelson Carlos De Los Santos Arias
SCREENPLAY: Nelson Carlo De Los Santos Arias
DOP: Camilo Soratti, Roman Lechapelier, Nelson Carlos De Los Santos Arias
EDITOR: Nelson Carlos De Los Santos Arias
CAST: Jhon Narváez, Sor María Ríos, Fareed Matjila, Harmony Ahalwa, Jorge Puntillón García, Shifafure Faustinus, Steven Alexander, Nicolás Marín Caly
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: A voice that claims to belong to a hippopotamus. A voice that does not understand the perception of time. A voice that tells of a historical event as if in a trance. “Am I making that sound that comes out of my mouth? And what is a mouth anyway?” The only thing the animal knows for sure is that it is dead. The first and only hippopotamus ever killed in the Americas. The Colombian press called him Pepe. Between encounters and misunderstandings, epiphanies and sadness, we enter a world full of stories replete with even more stories. In a serious and playful way, both authentic and deceptive, images and sounds narrate the overwhelming orality of places full of beings who, like Pepe, died without ever knowing where they really were.
AWARDS: Winner: Silver Bear for Best Director, Berlin International Festival 2024
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Berlin International Film Festival 2024, Toronto International Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Lav Diaz was born in Mindanao, Philippines, in 1958. He primarily focuses on social and political struggles in the Philippines. He has received many awards at prestigious film festivals, including the Golden Leopard at the Locarno Film Festival for From What Is Before (2014), the Golden Lion at the Venice Film Festival for The Woman Who Left (2016), and the Silver Bear at the Berlinale for A Lullaby to the Sorrowful Mystery (2016). His other films include Melancholia (2008), Prologue to the Great Desaparecido (2013), The Halt (2019), and Essential Truths of the Lake (2023).
PRODUCER: Lav Diaz, Paul Soriano, Mark Victor
CAST: Ronnie Lazaro, Janine Gutierrez, Paul Jake Paule, Hazel Orencio
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Hilarion Zabala, a former master sergeant, is tormented by a strange smell. The diagnosis is phantosmia, i.e. olfactory hallucinations, where he perceives smells that do not actually exist. His doctor attributes this to past trauma and recommends that he confront and recall his dark military service period as a solution. Zabala, willing to take on any task, voluntarily visits a military base and is eventually assigned to a remote island penal colony. However, another horrific reality awaits him there.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Venice International Film Festival 2024, Busan International Film Festival 2024
LINK TRAILER: Phantosmia new trailer official - Venice Film Festival 2024 - YouTube

DIRECTOR BIO: Federico Luis is a filmmaker born in Buenos Aires in 1990. He studied Social Communication Sciences at the UBA (University of Buenos Aires). His short film La Siesta had its international premiere at the 2019 Cannes Film Festival in the Official Short Film Competition. It was also distinguished with an Honorable Mention at the Toronto International Film Festival’s Shortcuts program and won Best Short Film at the 2019 BAFICI. In 2023, he received the award for Best Short at IDFA.
PRODUCER: Patricio Alvarez Casado, Fernando Bascuñán, Ignacio García Cucucovich, Carlos Rincones
SCREENPLAY: Federico Luis, Tomas Murphy, Agustin Toscano
CAST: Lorenzo Ferro, Pehuén Pedie, Kiara Supini, Laura Nevole, Agustín Toscano, Camila Hirane
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Simón is 21 years old. He introduces himself as a mover's helper. He claims not to know how to cook or clean the bathroom, but he does know how to make a bed. His parents are increasingly frustrated with odd changes in his behavior: he has become more withdrawn and appears to be affecting a strange, facial tic. But his new friends –a group of disabled teenagers– accept him as one of them, which clearly gives him a new sense of belonging. Federico Luis’ debut feature Simon of the Mountain is a playful and provocative drama that deftly questions societal attitudes and social boundaries and reinvents familiar scenes from a more conventional coming of age drama with fascinating new twists.
AWARDS: Winner: Semaine de la critique Grand Prix, Cannes Film Festival 2024
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Cannes Film Festival 2024, San Sebastián International Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Adilkhan Yerzhanov was born in the Jezkazgan region of Kazakhstan, and was educated as a filmmaker at the Kazakhstan National Academy of Arts. Yerzhanov is a two-time participant in the Cannes Film Festival’s Official Programme (The Owners, 2014 and The Gentle Indifference of the World, 2018) as well as the Venice International Film Festival (Yellow Cat, 2020 and Goliath, 2022). Yerzhanov also won the Asia Pacific Screen Award for Achievement in Directing for his A Dark, Dark Man (2019) and is currently a member of the European Film Academy.
PRODUCER: Aliya Mendygozhina, Alexander Rodnyansky, Olga Khlasheva
CAST: Azamat Nigmanov, Yerkin Gubashev, Nurbek Mukushev
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: A civil war rages across a vast, seemingly unpopulated landscape. As men fight and die, a mute woman searches for her son who has been kidnapped by child organ traffickers. She is accompanied by ‘the Steppenwolf’, a reformed ex-convict now hardened into a ruthless investigator. They resemble a bloody odd couple, but are determined to see their mission through, removing every obstacle – most of them human – in their path. Adilkhan’s Steppenwolf stands as a testament to his cinematic prowess, skillfully interweaving classic elements from stylised Westerns, road movies and bloody revenge dramas.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: International Film Festival Of Rotterdam 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: One of France's most important filmmakers, Bruno Dumont directed his debut feature film Life of Jesus in 1997, which was selected for the Director’s Fortnight at Cannes. His feature films Humanity and Flanders both won the Grand Prize of the Jury at Cannes, while Slack Bay and, more recently, the satire France, starring Lea Seydoux as a famous journalist, also screened in competition at the festival.
CAST: Lyna Khoudri, Anamaria Vartolomei, Camille Cottin, Fabrice Luchini, Brandon Vlieghe, Julien Manier
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: The Opal Coast, northern France. In a quiet and picturesque fishing village, something finally happens: a special baby is born. A child so unique and peculiar that it unleashes a secret war between extraterrestrial forces of good and evil. On the one hand, The Empire plays like a Star Wars spoof, and on the other is a natural extension of Dumont’s transcendent style, spiked with crude sexuality and freak-show mysticism à la Twin Peaks.
AWARDS: Winner: Jury Prize, Berlin International Film Festival 2024
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Berlin International Film Festival 2024

COUNTRY: Denmark, Germany, Ireland, Italy, United Kingdom, Sweden
DIRECTOR BIO: Joshua Oppenheimer is an American filmmaker who works in both documentary and fiction. He holds a B.A. from Harvard and a Ph.D. from Central St. Martins College of Arts and Design in London. His directorial credits include the “pseudo-documentary” The Entire History of the Louisiana Purchase (98) and the documentaries The Act of Killing (2012) and The Look of Silence (2014).
PRODUCER: Signe Byrge Sørensen, Joshua Oppenheimer, Tilda Swinton, Viola Fügen, Conor Barry, Flaminio Zadra, Tracy O’Riordan, Ann Lundberg
CAST: Tilda Swinton, George MacKay, Moses Ingram, Michael Shannon
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Best known for his groundbreaking documentary, The Act of Killing (2012), Joshua Oppenheimer makes his fiction feature debut with The End, a story about what seems to be the last remaining human family on earth, as they hide in an ornate bunker built deep inside a salt mine after environmental collapse has destroyed society. George MacKay, born in this bunker, has only heard stories of the outside world. He spends his days working on a dubious book with his father, a former energy tycoon, while his mother frets over the upkeep of the many priceless paintings and artworks adorning their walls. It’s the semblance of a normal (albeit affluent) life. But when a woman from the outside arrives at their doorstep seeking refuge, the family’s delicate dynamic begins to crumble.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Toronto International Film Festival 2024, San Sebastián International Film Festival 2024
TAGS: Hybrids, Comedy, Social Impact, Festival Hits

DIRECTOR BIO: Born in Tehran, Iran in 1988, he began his career in photography, video and video installations before gradually moving towards his true passion of filmmaking. He has made more than ten music videos for independent Iranian bands which have been screened at various festivals. His first short film, In Between, won the Best Debut Film award at the 2018 Tirana International Film Festival. It was followed by America, his second short. Khamyazeye bozorg is his first feature-length film.
CAST: Mohammad Aghebati, Amirhossein Hosseini, Saber Abar, Mahin Sadri, Mehrdad Ziaie, Ramin Alizadeh
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Beitollah is a man who constantly dreams of finding a cave with gold coins in a coffer. Against the precepts of his religion, he wishes to find this treasure, and recruits a young atheist, Shoja, as his assistant. Together they embark on a quest that will take them to different parts of the Iranian landscape. The Great Yawn narrates an odyssey where the oneiric, and even the absurd, intrude on reality. A journey of external exploration that ends up revealing the tensions between two apparently opposing characters, who nevertheless find in each other a mirror to look into.
AWARDS: Winner: Encounters Special Jury Award, Berlin International Film Festival 2024
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Berlin International Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Delphine and Muriel Coulin are a French writer-filmmaker duo. Muriel graduated from the prestigious Louis Lumière school, and started her career as a camera assistant. Delphine studied literature and political science before taking charge of the documentaries program for the Franco-German TV Group Arte. In 1995, the two sisters started directing short films together, and iIn 2011, they directed their first feature film, 17 girls, which was screened at La Semaine de la Critique (Cannes).
SCREENPLAY: Delphine Coulin, Muriel Coulin, Laurent Petitmangin
CAST: Vincent Lindon, Benjamin Voisin, Stefan Crepon, Sophie Guillemin, Hugo Bariller, Denis Simonetta, Thomas Arnaud, Franco Provenzano, Abdel Bouchendidkh
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Pierre, a widowed 50 year old man, raises his two sons alone. The three of them are very close. Louis, the younger son, is about to leave home to go to university in Paris. On the other hand, Fus, the elder one, has become withdrawn, and is slowly evincing an interest in far-right extremist activities, going against everything his father believes in. Set in France’s Grand Est region, where decades of rising unemployment have opened the doors to a wave of far-right radicalism, The Quiet Son is as revealing of our contemporary world as it is of the one to come.
AWARDS: Coppa Volpi for Best Actor, and Collateral Impact Award, Venice Film Festival 2024
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Venice Film Festival 2024, Busan International Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Quentin Dupieux is a filmmaker and musician from France. Dupieux is considered a true auteur, being the writer, editor and director of photography for all his films. He has even (co-)composed the music for half of his films, many of which have had their world premieres at festivals such as Cannes, Venice and Sundance. Dupieux’ films are unique and skew away from narrative conventions, with a penchant for the absurd. His Incredible But True (2022) premiered at Berlinale, Smoking Causes Coughing (2022) in Cannes, while Daaaaaali! (2023) was selected for IFFR 2024.
CAST: Léa Seydoux, Vincent Lindon, Louis Garrel, Raphaël Quenard
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Florence wants to introduce David, the man she’s madly in love with, to her father Guillaume. But David isn’t attracted to Florence and wants to throw her into the arms of his friend Willy. The four of them meet in a restaurant in the middle of nowhere, where they suddenly begin to act out a scene from a third-rate movie production. Quentin Dupieux’s latest film is self-referential cinema at its best, in which, much like his other films, the absurd becomes a genre unto itself.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Cannes Film Festival 2024

LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: 25-year-old Merey lives a quiet but happy life in Almaty. By chance, she meets the charming Nurlan, who invites her to a birthday party in the mountains. She expects a simple celebration with new friends, but what ensues is an intense and tumultuous night that quickly spirals into a dark game of cat and mouse.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Locarno International Film Festival 2024

TITLE ORIGINAL: Cu Li Không Bao Giờ Khóc
DIRECTOR BIO:
Born and raised in Hanoi, Lân graduated with a degree in urban planning and taught himself filmmaking at 27. His short films include The Story of
Ones (2012, Visions du Réel); Another City (2016, Berlinale); Blessed Land (2019, Berlinale) and The Unseen River (2021, Locarno, Sundance). Cu Li
Never Cries is his first featurelength film.

CAST: Minh Chau, Ha Phuong, Xuan An, Hoang Ha
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: A woman tries to cling onto dimming links to her past after inheriting a pygmy slow loris from her long-estranged husband. Meanwhile, her niece prepares for marriage as the young couple ponders their gloomy future together. The present and the complex echoes of Vietnamese history are entwined before a contemplative and poetic perspective.

DIRECTOR BIO: Thibault Emin is a French director and screenwriter. He studied film at Paris 8 University, and then at La Fémis. He’s directed several short films, including the short film Else (2007), which formed the basis for his feature debut. Else (24) is his latest film.
SCREENPLAY: Thibault Emin, Alice Butaud, Emma Sandona
CAST: Matthieu Sampeur, Edith Proust, Lika Minamoto
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Anx has just met Cass when a mysterious virus breaks out: everywhere, people’s bodies are merging with objects. Stuck in their apartment, the couple must now face this dreadful threat. A mesmerising body-horror romance, Else profoundly articulates a unique vision of the end of everything, and how it may, in fact, just be the start of something new.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Toronto International Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Sarah Gyllenstierna was born in Stockholm, Sweden. She is a producer and director, known for Juice (1992) and He Got Game (1998).
CAST: Ardalan Esmaili, Magnus Krepper, Jens Hultén
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Three men go on an extended weekend hunting trip deep in the Swedish forest. Gregor and Henrik are old friends and more experienced hunters, while Alex is a novice (and Gregor’s protégé at work). Their trip is initially greeted by success on the hunt, sharpening their instincts in the field and drumming up a rivalry between the three men. But one day all the animals vanish without a trace, leaving the forest eerily quiet and the men with nothing to hunt. Spurred on by overactive male bravado, the misguided macho inclination to compare themselves to men of the past, and a bit of natural hallucinogens, the trio find a way for the hunt to continue, even in a forest without animals.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Tribeca Film Festival 2024
LINK TRAILER: TRAILER - Hunters on a White Field (2024)

DIRECTOR BIO: Driven by her love for visually intriguing and innovative storytelling, Annick Blanc co- founded Midi La Nuit with Maria Gracia Turgeon. As a director, Hunting Daze (2023) is her first feature film. Her filmography of shorts includes: The Colour of Your Lips (2019), Turn Off Before Living (2015) and Nowhere Elsewhere (2010) which have garnered prizes at many a festivals. As a producer she has helped create more than 15 projects, which have been screened at prestigious film festivals. Amongst them Who Do I Belong To (2024, Berlinale Competition), Hunting Daze (2023, SXSW), Brotherhood (2019 - Oscar nominee, Best Canadian Short TIFF), and Fauve (2018 - Oscar nominee, Sundance Jury Prize).
CAST: Nahéma Ricci, Bruno Marcil, Frédéric Millaire-Zouvi, Marc Beaupré, Alexandre Landry, Maxime Genois, Noubi Ndiaye
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Nina, a headstrong young woman, joins a group of hunters at a remote cabin. In this male micro-society, she finally feels a newfound sense of belonging. But the delicate balance of their pack is threatened with the arrival of a mysterious stranger.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: SXSW 2024

COUNTRY: United States, United Kingdom, France, South Africa
DIRECTOR BIO: Will Seefried is an award-winning writer, director & filmmaker. He is known for Lilies Not for Me (2024), Homesick (2022) and Sink Sank Sunk (2018).
CAST: Fionn O’Shea, Robert Aramayo, Louis Hoffman, Erin Kellyman, Jodi Balfour
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: In 1920s England, a gay novelist and his psychiatric nurse form an unlikely friendship over a series of doctor-prescribed ‘dates’. Through their conversations, he tells her the story of his relationship with an old friend which spiraled out of control when they turned to a risky procedure to cure themselves of their forbidden feelings for one another.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Edinburgh International Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Mariana Wainstein is a writer and director. She’s directed short films including Las Hormigas (2017) and Error 404 (2016). Linda (2024) is her feature debut.
PRODUCER: Pablo E. Bossi, Cabe Bossi, Pol Bossi.
SCREENPLAY: Mariana Wainstein, Diego Bliffeld, Luciano Cocciardi, Horacio Convertini, Juan Cordoni, Sabrina Campos, Nancy Gai
CAST: Eugenia China Suárez, Rafael Spregelburd, Julieta Cardinali, Minerva Casero
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Self-assured, mysterious, and captivating Linda agrees to work at an affluent home in Buenos Aires, covering for her cousin who’s recovering from an accident. Her charm sparks strong sexual attraction among all four members of the family, exposing how fragile their externally happy veneer really is. Turning away from grand gestures, the narrative drills on the mundane to explore Linda's shattering of the male egos involved as well as the power dynamic between the female employer and the “help".
FESTIVAL HISTORY:
Toronto International Film Festival 2024,
Zurich International Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: KEFF is a Taiwanese-American multidisciplinary artist based in New York and Taipei. He recently completed the NYU Graduate Film program on scholarship. His first short film, Secret Lives of Asians at Night, was supported by the Spike Lee Film Fellowship, and awarded the Jury Prize for Best Asian-American Film by the Director's Guild of America. His second short film and NYU thesis, Taipei Suicide Story, had its world premiere at the Cannes Film Festival (Cinéfondation), and won the Grand Jury Prize (Narrative Feature) at the Slamdance Film Festival. He is also an open-format DJ and producer that has performed with countless international artists at parties such as Brownies & Lemonade (LA), SHOWER @ Soap (Korea), SUBBEAT @ Cakeshop (Korea) and BangOn! (NYC).
EDITOR: KEFF, Siuloku O., Jenson Tay Yi
CAST: Liu Wei-chen, Rimong Ihwar, Devin Pan, Yu An Shun, Wu Yi-Jung
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: As the 2019 Hong Kong protests erupt across the strait, Zhong-Han, a silent twenty-nothing in Taiwan, leads a double life – working at a family restaurant by day, and running with a group of local gangsters by night. But when the ownership of the restaurant changes hands, it sets off an unexpected chain reaction that forces Zhong-Han to witness and confront the corrupt power games of his country.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Cannes Film Festival 2024, Warsaw International Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Marianna Brennand, after graduating with a degree in film at UCSB, made Francisco Brennanda (2012), a documentary about a Brazilian artist globally recognized for his ceramic work, who was also her great-uncle Francisco. The film won both Best Brazilian Documentary and Best Brazilian Film at the São Paulo Film Festival. Manas marks Brennand’s feature film directorial debut and is the result of a ten-year research into the complex and delicate subject of the sexual abuse and exploitation of children and teenagers on Marajó Island, in the Amazon rainforest.
SCREENPLAY:
Felipe Sholl, Marcelo Grabowsky, Marianna Brennand, Antonia Pellegrino,
Camila Agustini, Carolina Benevides
CAST: Jamilli Correa, Fátima Macedo, Rômulo Braga, Dira Paes, Emilu Pantoja, Samira Eloá, Gabriel Rodrigues, Enzo Maia
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Island of Marajó, Amazon rainforest. Marcielle,13, lives by the riverbanks with her father, mother, and three siblings. Prompted by her mother's words, she idolizes her older sister who supposedly escaped her reality by "finding a good man" on the barges that ply the region. As Tielle matures, her idealized visions shatter, leaving her trapped between two abusive environments. Increasingly worried about her younger sister and the bleak future they face, she decides to confront the oppressive system that controls her family and the women in their community.
AWARDS: Giornate degli Autori Director's Award, Venice International Film Festival 2024
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Venice International Film Festival 2024
TAGS: Films By Women, Global Politics, De/Gendered, Social Impact

TITLE ORIGINAL: Memorias De Un Cuerpo Que Arde
DIRECTOR BIO: Her first film, The Awakening of the Ants (2019), premiered at the Berlinale Forum, in 2019 and was selected for more than 65 international festivals, representing the country at the Academy Awards and becoming the first Costa Rican film to be recognized by the Platino Awards and the first Central American movie to receive a Goya Award nomination. Memories of a Burning Body is her second feature film.
CAST: Sol Carball, Paulina Bernini, Juliana Filloy, Liliana Biamonte
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Growing up in a repressive era when sexuality was a taboo subject, 68-year-old Ana, 69-year-old Patricia and 71-year-old Mayela developed their understanding of what it means to be a woman based on unspoken rules and implicit expectations. Now they dare to talk about it openly. The memories, secrets and longings of the three are interwoven in a poetic way: while the women tell their stories off-screen, they are lived out in the body of another woman of their generation.
AWARDS: Panorama Audience Award, Berlin International Film Festival 2024
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Berlin International Film Festival 2024, Istanbul Film Festival 2024, Rio de Janeiro International Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Catalan artist and filmmaker Albert Serra holds a degree in Spanish Philology and Literary Theory. His films –Birdsong (2008), Story of my Death (2013), Liberté (2019), Pacifiction (2022)– have premiered and won awards at festivals such as Cannes, Locarno, TIFF and IFFR.
PRODUCER: Pedro Palacios, Ricard Sales, Montse Triola, Luis Ferrón, Pierre-Olivier Bardet, Albert Serra, Joaquim Sapinho
CAST: Andrez Roca Rey
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Filmmaker Albert Serra trains a patient and poetic lens on the dazzling pomp and devastating brutality of bullfighting in his new documentary portrait of the charismatic Peruvian-born star torero Andrés Roca Rey. Intensely in-the-moment, Afternoons of Solitude expertly balances the visceral thrill of the battle inside the ring, pitting animal instinct against human technique, with a meditative filmmaking style that allows the viewer to appreciate the emotional and physical toll the violence takes on both man and beast.
AWARDS: Golden Shell for Best Film, San Sebastian Film Festival 2024
FESTIVAL HISTORY: San Sebastián International Film Festival 2024, New York Film Festival 2024, Tokyo International Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Shiori Ito is a journalist, writer, and documentary filmmaker with a focus on gender-based human rights issues. In 2020, Time magazine listed her as one of the 100 Most Influential People in the world. Black Box Diaries is her feature documentary.
PRODUCER: Eric Nyari, Hanna Aqvilin, Shiori Itō
DOP: Yuta Okamura, Hanna Aqvilin, Shiori Itō, Yuichiro Otsuka, Keke Shiratama
CAST: Shiori Itō
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Journalist Shiori Itō turns the camera on herself in a breathtakingly courageous investigation of her own sexual assault, which resulted in a landmark case for the Me Too movement in Japan. From courtrooms to video diary entries, the film follows Itō’s 2017 court battle in real time, made all the more gripping by its palpable mix of journalistic acumen and harrowing trauma. Along the journey to bring Itō’s high-powered attacker to justice, Black Box Diaries also becomes an indictment of the legal system and social customs that actively thwart survivors of abuse.
AWARDS: Human Rights Award, CPH:DOX 2024
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Sundance Film Festival 2024, SXSW Film Festival 2024, CPH:DOX 2024, BFI London Film Festival 2024
TAGS: Documentary, Social Impact, De/Gendered, Films By Women

DIRECTOR BIO: Veljko Vidak is a Croatian filmmaker and artist. He graduated from the Academy of Fine Arts of Zagreb, and was later awarded a grant that enabled him to study at the Cité Internationale Des Arts in Paris. Cinéma Laika is his first documentary feature.
CAST: Aki Kaurismäki, Jim Jarmusch, Simon Al-Bazoon, Nuppu Koivu, Maustetytöt, Veljko Vidak
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: In a small picturesque village in Finland, Aki Kaurismäki and his friend, the poet and writer Mika Lätti, are constructing their own cinema theater within an old foundry. The cinema will be called Kino Laika – named after Kaurismäki’s dogs – and to help them, they have the colourful inhabitants of Karkkila, who wear leather jackets and race around in Cadillacs to the sounds of rock n’ roll. ‘Cinema Laika’ is a warm mix of deadpan Finnish humour and French elegance, deriving clear inspiration from Kaurismäki’s own signature style.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: CPH:DOX 2024, Jeonju International Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Mati Diop is a French filmmaker and actress working in both France and Senegal. Her formally adventurous films explore exile, identity, memory and loss using fiction and documentary tools. Her first feature Atlantics (2019) was awarded the Grand Prix at the Cannes Film Festival.
PRODUCER: Eve Robin, Judith Lou Lévy, Mati Diop
CAST: Gildas Adannou, Habib Ahandessi, Joséa Guedje, Imelda Batamoussi
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: The African kingdom of Dahomey saw hundreds of its splendid royal artifacts plundered by French colonial troops in its waning days. Now, 26 of these treasures are set to return to their homeland. Filmmaker Mati Diop takes a singular approach to contemporary questions around belonging in our postcolonial world, transforming this rich subject matter into a multifaceted examination of ownership and exhibition, and employing multiple points of view, including—most strikingly—those of the artifacts themselves as they sail in darkness over the ocean to their original home.
AWARDS: Golden Bear, Berlin International Film Festival 2024
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Berlin International Film Festival 2024, Toronto International Film Festival 2024, San Sebastián International Film Festival 2024
TAGS: Documentary, Global Politics, Films By Women, Festival Hits, Historical

DIRECTOR BIO: Michael Dweck is a filmmaker and visual artist whose work explores ongoing struggles between identity and adaptation within endangered societal enclaves. Gregory Kershaw is an award-winning filmmaker whose work explores the complexity of humans confronting an ever-changing world. Their film The Truffle Hunters (2020) was selected for over 45 international festivals and was also shortlisted for the Oscars (Best Documentary).
PRODUCER: Michael Dweck, Gregory Kershaw, Matthew Perniciaro, Christos V. Konstantakopoulos, Cameron O'Reilly
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: In the endless plains and desolate mountains of Argentina live the so-called gauchos. Cowboys and cowgirls dressed in beautiful uniforms and with an almost spiritual connection to their horses and the land they ride on. They drink, mate, race, gallop and lasso as their ancestors have always done. Out here among cacti and dusty cornfields, the gauchos keep the traditions of the past alive. Gaucho Gaucho is a celebration of a community suspended in time, floating between the past and present, dream and reality.
AWARDS: U.S. Documentary Special Jury Award for Sound, Sundance Film Festival 2024 I Letterboxd Piazza Grande Award, Locarno International Film Festival 2024
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Sundance Film Festival 2024, Locarno International Film Festival 2024, CPH:DOX 2024, Melbourne International Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Ali Asgari is a prominent figure in international cinema with more than 200 awards to his name. He is an alumnus of Berlinale Talent Campus 2013 and Locarno Summer Academy 2016. His films have been screened at prestigious festivals such as Cannes, Venice and IFFR.
CAST: Ali Asgari, Roghayeh Ahmadi, Hajar, Nahid, Zahra
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: When his film on air pollution in Iran stirs trouble with the authorities, a filmmaker embarks on a turbulent journey through the realms of memory and dream. Ali Asgari’s follow-up to his critically acclaimed Terrestrial Verses (2023) is a hybrid and boundary pushing film that utilizes both documentary and narrative elements in its quest to connect the personal with the political.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: International Documentary Film Festival Amsterdam 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Elizabeth holds a BFA from NYU Tisch School of the Arts and an MFA from Stanford University. A filmmaker from Hong Kong, her films have been showcased at festivals such as Sundance, IDFA, SXSW, Tribeca, MoMA, and AFI Fest.
PRODUCER: Emma D. Miller, Elizabeth Lo, Maggie Li
CAST: Wang Zhenxi
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: In China, a new industry has emerged devoted to helping couples stay married in the face of infidelity. Wang Zhenxi is part of this growing profession, a “mistress dispeller” who is hired to maintain the bonds of marriage by any means necessary. Offering strikingly intimate access to private dramas usually hidden behind closed doors, Mistress Dispeller explores the ways in which emotion, pragmatism and cultural norms collide to shape romantic relationships in contemporary China.
AWARDS: Authors Under 40 Award - Best Direction, Venice Film Festival 2024
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Venice Film Festival 2024, Toronto International Film Festival 2024, Zurich Film Festival 2024
TAGS: Documentary, Social Impact, Films By Women
