DIRECTOR BIO: Wang Bing is a leading figure of the documentary movement that has been gathering vital momentum within Chinese cinema. His work, which spans documentary, fiction, video installation, and shorts, has premiered and won awards at festivals such as Cannes, Venice, Berlin, and Locarno.
PRODUCER: Sonia Buchman, Mao Hui, Nicolas R. De La Mothe, Vincent Wang
DOP: Shan Xiaohui, Song Yang, Ding Bihan, Liu Xianhui, Maeda Yoshitaka, Wang Bing
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Youth (Hard Times) is the second chapter of Wang Bing’s monumental opus on the diminished youth of China, who work seemingly endless hours and have traded life for financial exploitation. Here, Wang Bing broadens his exploration of lives in the garment district from the cramped, overcrowded workshops of Zhili to the Yangtze Delta region’s unique and complex economy. Throughout, Wang Bing’s impassive gaze engages us in a tactile experience of life in the workshops, delivering an epic, unsparing — yet devoid of miserabilism — portrait of the indomitable spirit of youth.
AWARDS: FIPRESCI Prize, Special Mention: Concorso Internazionale, Locarno Film Festival 2024
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Locarno Film Festival 2024, Busan International Film Festival 2024, Toronto International Film Festival 2024
TAGS: Documentary, Social Impact, Global Politics, Festival Hits

DIRECTOR BIO: Wang Bing is a leading figure of the documentary movement that has been gathering vital momentum within Chinese cinema. His work, which spans documentary, fiction, video installation, and shorts, has premiered and won awards at festivals such as Cannes, Venice, Berlin, and Locarno.
PRODUCER: Sonia Buchman, Mao Hui, Nicolas R. De La Mothe, Vincent Wang
DOP: Liu Xianhui, Song Yang, Ding Bihan, Shan Xiaohui, Maeda Yoshitaka,Wang Bing
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Wang Bing concludes his monumental Youth trilogy in expansive fashion, giving ever wider scope to the lives of migrant workers in Zhili’s textile factories. Centered around New Year’s break, when the workers are planning to visit their families in remote hometowns to celebrate the festivities, Homecoming functions as a sweeping portrait of contemporary rural China, incorporating images of tightly packed trains, buses climbing treacherous mountainside roads, and wedding celebrations for workers into its scenes of factory life.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Venice Film Festival 2024, Toronto International Film Festival 2024, BFI London Film Festival 2024
TAGS: Documentary, Social Impact, Global Politics, Festival Hits

DIRECTOR BIO: Niles Atallah is a filmmaker and artist who lives and works in Santiago, Chile. His first feature Lucia (2010) premiered at the San Sebastián Film Festival, and his second feature Rey (2017) won a Special Jury Award in the Tiger Competition at IFFR.
CAST: Andrea Gómez, Daniela Ossa
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: A tale of metamorphosis of a post-apocalyptic being. Navigating a labyrinth populated by fantastical creatures, an amphibious humanoid searches for water amid the ruins of a fallen world. In this eclectic fantasy of discarded dreams, echoes of an imaginary sea guide this creature towards a new dawn. In Animalia Paradoxa the body becomes a site of experimentation: a meeting point for the avant-garde, animation and performance art.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: International Film Festival Rotterdam 2024, Fantasia Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO:
Radu Jude is one of the most prominent figures in contemporary Romanian cinema. His films have been selected for more than 50 international film festivals, and have won awards at top international festivals.
Christian Ferencz-Flatz is a researcher at the Alexandru Dragomir Institute for Philosophy and an associated professor at the National University of Theatre and Film.
CAST: Gheorghe Hagi, Sandu Mihai Gruia, Alexandru Bindea
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: For his new found footage documentary, Radu Jude, the most offbeat of Romanian filmmakers, has taken on an incredible challenge: to expose the psyche of his country through… advertising! Eight Postcards from Utopia collects and reworks hundreds of promotional images produced from the end of the socialist era to the present day. Jude examines Romania’s long transition period as a country newly introduced to contemporary consumer culture and the idea of endless possibilities. Wonderfully playful in form, this is a hilarious, innovative and provocative portrait of a country’s recent history.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Locarno International Film Festival 2024, BFI London Film Festival 2024
LINK TRAILER: IDFA 2024 | Trailer | Eight Postcards from Utopia

DIRECTOR BIO: Georg Tiller studied philosophy and theatre before he transferred to the Film Academy of Vienna, where Michael Haneke was his teacher. Tiller’s films have been screened and awarded at renowned film festivals such as Berlinale, Venice, and IFFR.
SCREENPLAY: Georg Tiller, Edward Weki, Maéva Ranaïvojaona
CAST: Felicia Godman, Marita Kunnari, Manuela de Gouveia
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Edward Wek is a 75-year-old Sudanese man with Parkinson’s disease. Soon, Bergmanesque ghosts begin to appear at Weki’s bedside: Alma, a revenant of the nurse of the same name from Ingmar Bergman’s film Persona, along with a female version of Death from The Seventh Seal, both helping him track down lost memories. Godsterminal is unpredictable in the same way memories seemingly hit us out of nowhere, slowly but surely leading Edward back to himself and his predicament.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: International Film Festival Rotterdam 2024

TITLE ENGLISH: Sanatorium Under the Sign of the Hourglass
DIRECTOR BIO: The Quay Brothers studied at the Philadelphia College of Art, then later in London at the Royal College of Art. They are renowned for their artisanal animation films with macabre overtones, the most popular among them being ‘Institute Benjamenta, or This Dream People Call Human Life’.
CAST: Tadeusz Janiszewski, Wioletta Kopańska, Andrzej Kłak
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: A man travels by train to a sanatorium in Eastern Europe after being informed that his father has died there. When he arrives, however, he finds the sanatorium in a state of decline. His father turns out to be alive, but only now and then. Jozef will come to realise that the sanatorium is a floating world halfway between sleep and wakefulness, and that time and events cannot be measured in any tangible form.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Venice Film Festival 2024, BFI London Film Festival 2024
LINK TRAILER: Sanatorium Under The Sign Of The Hourglass | Clip | Quay Brothers

DIRECTOR BIO: Edgar Pêra is an experimental filmmaker from Lisbon, Portugal. He has made countless documentaries, short films, and features, and has also created Internet productions, live shows, and exhibitions. In 2019, the IFFR honoured Pêra with a career-spanning retrospective at the festival.
CAST: Victoria Guerra, Keith Esher Davis, Bárbara Lagido
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Telepathic Letters is a film with images created exclusively through AI, and in which a dialogue is established between two of the most influential writers of the 20th century, H.P. Lovecraft and Fernando Pessoa. Fusing Pessoa’s Sensationism with Lovecraft’s strange realism, the film concocts an imaginary correspondence between the two authors, creating a new universe of artistic and literary possibilities.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Locarno International Film Festival 2024, Oldenberg Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Alberto Gracia’ work spans a variety of forms including painting, drawing, performance, video and installations. His debut film The Fifth Gospel of Kaspar Hauser (2013) and his second feature The Wandering Star (2016) both had their world premiere at IFFR.
PRODUCER: Beli Martínez, Roi Carballido, Javier Tasio
CAST: Alfonso Míguez, Pilar Soto, Lorena Iglesias, Emilio Buale
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Damián subsists on his meagre income, existing more than living. When he receives news that his father has died, he returns to Ferrol, his hometown, which he has stayed away from for over two decades. No sooner has he arrived than he finds himself the subject of mistaken identity, and his fate is now entwined with another whose destiny is predetermined. Told in elliptical fashion and moving to a rhythm all its own, La Parra presents a surreal and compassionate portrait of a community that despite its misery hasn’t given up on searching for a better future.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: International Film Festival Rotterdam 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Elza Gauja is a Latvian fillmmaker who has directed the documentary feature Meanwhile in Lucavsala (2022) and the feature dramedy Keep Smiling Mom! (2022) — the latter of which was selected for the Tallinn Black Nights' FF Works In Progress section.
PRODUCER: Elza Gauja, Andris Gauja, Ugis Riekstins, Marta Šleiere
CAST: Indra Burkovska, Janis Jarans, Ivars Brakovskis, Liena Smukste
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: A senior couple, Ernests and Alvīne, work in a post office and dream of winning a trip to Rome. But, as the couple grapples with Alvīne’s fast-progressing Alzheimer’s, the tone shifts to a more poignant portrayal of Ernests’ attempts to cope with his wife’s memory loss and her diminishing sharpness of thought.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Sydney International Film Festival 2024
LINK TRAILER: A Postcard From Rome | Trailer - SFF 24

TITLE ENGLISH: A Sudden Glimpse to Deeper Things
DIRECTOR BIO: Mark Cousins is an Irish documentary filmmaker, film critic and programmer. A prolific producer and director, he is best known for his 15-hour documentary The Story of Film: An Odyssey (2011).
CAST: Tilda Swinton
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: The work of the late Scottish artist Wilhelmina Barns-Graham is brought to life by this idiosyncratically persuasive Mark Cousins film. A creative biography of the Scottish artist Wilhelmina Barns-Graham, narrated by Tilda Swinton, the film is a personal journey through art and the great mystery of creativity.
AWARDS: Grand Prix Crystal Globe, Karlovy Vary International Film Festival 2024
FESTIVAL HISTORY:
Karlovy Vary International Film Festival 2024, Vancouver International Film Festival
2024

COUNTRY: Tunisia, France, Italy, Saudi Arabia, Qatar
DIRECTOR BIO: Mehdi M. Barsaoui is a Tunisian filmmaker. He is best known as the director of the critically acclaimed feature film A Son (2019) and the shorts Sideways (2010) and Bobby (2014).
PRODUCER: Mohamed Habib Attia, Flaminio Zadra, Marc Irmer
CAST: Fatma Sfar, Yasmine Dimassi, Nidhal Saadi
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Aya, in her late twenties, still lives with her parents in Southern Tunisia and feels trapped in a life without prospects. As the sole survivor of an accident, Aya realizes it could be her chance to start a new life. She flees to Tunis under a new identity, but now finds herself embroiled in a murder case.
AWARDS: Best Mediterranean Film, Venice Film Festival 2024
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Venice Film Festival 2024, BFI London Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Chakib Taleb-Bendiab is an Algerian screenwriter, filmmaker, and composer. He has worked on many feature films and is one of the screenwriters behind the British spy series GO DARK. Chakib Taleb-Bendiab's filmography includes several compelling short films.
CAST: Meriem Medjkane, Nabil Asli, Chahrazad Kracheni, Hichem Mesbah, Ali Namous
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: The kidnapping of a little girl creates tension and suspicion in Algiers. Only Dounia, a brilliant psychiatrist, and Sami, a police inspector, can unearth the demons of the past.

DIRECTOR BIO: Ray Yeung is a Hong Kong screenwriter and independent film director whose films frequently center around gay narratives. He made his feature film debut with Cut Sleeve Boys (2006).
PRODUCER: Michael J. Werner, Teresa Kwong, Sandy Yip, Chowee Leow
EDITOR: William Chang Suk Ping, Lai Kwun Tung
CAST: Patra Au Ga Man,Maggie Li Lin Lin,Tai Bo, Leung Chung Hang, Fish Liew Chi Yu, Hui So Ying, Rachel Leung, Luna Shaw Mei Kwan
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Angie and Pat are a couple living in Hong Kong who have been together for over four decades. After Pat's unexpected death, Angie finds herself at the mercy of her extended family as she struggles to retain both her dignity and the home that they shared for over thirty years.
AWARDS: Teddy Award for Best Fiction, Berlin International Film Festival 2024
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Berlin International Film Festival 2024, BFI London Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: With over a dozen short films showcased at international festivals, Gustavo’s work has earned him recognition across the globe. American Warrior is his debut feature.
PRODUCER: Naveen A. Chathapuram, Cristy Coors Beasley, Rashaana Shah
CAST: Danny Trejo, Veronica Falcón, Vishy Ayyar, Taylor Treadwell
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: American Warrior delves into the journey of an Indian-American immigrant and former amateur MMA fighter, recently released from incarceration, who seeks redemption and transformation. After intervening in a convenience store robbery, he becomes an unlikely local hero, thrust into the unforgiving spotlight of fame.

DIRECTOR BIO: Victor graduated with a degree in screenwriting and directing from the Moscow Film School. Since then, his films have received numerous prizes at major international film festivals. His previous film, Gunda, premiered in the Encounters section at the 2020 Berlinale.
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Centering on a landscape project by the Italian architect Michele De Lucchi, Kossakovsky uses the circle to reflect on the rise and fall of civilisations, capturing breathtaking imagery from the temple ruins of Baalbek in Lebanon, dating back to AD 60, to the recent destruction of cities in Turkey following a 7.8 magnitude earthquake in early 2023. Rocks and stone connect the disparate societies, from ghostly monoliths stuck in the earth to tragic heaps of concrete rubble waiting to be hauled off and repurposed anew. From filmmaker Victor Kossakovsky comes an epic, intimate and poetic meditation on architecture and how the design and construction of buildings from the ancient past reveal our destruction – and offer hope for survival and a way forward.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Berlin International Film Festival 2024, Karlovy Vary International Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Charles Hu studied cinema at the Communication University of Zhejiang from 2015 to 2019. His works often focus on themes of loneliness and exile. His first feature film was River Straying (2019).
CAST:
Dylan Xiong, Eva Zhao, Haosen Zheng,
Mason Zhang
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Xiaoli is a train driver fed up with his tedious job. One afternoon, an earthquake, which is an aftershock from another earthquake 12 years ago, suddenly strikes the town. After the earthquake, Xiao Li begins to develop symptoms from an unknown illness. Ghosts of the past resurface, stirring up long-buried secrets of his father's disappearance and memories of a tragic game of hide-and-seek by the river.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Busan International Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Necmi Sancak studied film at Santa Monica College and California State Northridge in Los Angeles from 2009 to 2015. After directing several short films in Los Angeles, he founded one of Turkey's most significant film festivals abroad, the Los Angeles Turkish Film Festival.
SCREENPLAY: Necmi Sancak, Binnur Kaya, Ahmet Sancak
CAST: Binnur Kaya, Ridvan Sancak, Nazlican Demir
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Ayşe (47) lives with her brother Ridvan (38), who has Down Syndrome, on the outer edge of the ever-growing Istanbul. Their father has been ill for a long time, and is spends his days awaiting death. When Ayşe receives a marriage proposal from an international truck driver who stops by the gas station where she works, she makes a choice between her destiny and her dreams.

DIRECTOR BIO: Mansour Vosoughi studied filmmaking, and started working as an assistant director in the Iranian industry. He has also made some short films and TV episodes.
CAST:
Amir Jafari, Rima Raminfar, Setareh Pesyani, Nafas Bazeghi, Amirshahab RazaviyanKey,
Ali Bagheri
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Yahya, a man with a mysterious past, sets off into the wilderness with a car that serves as his home, and makes ends meet by cutting and selling the hair of impoverished women and girls. He comes across a clever 15-year-old girl whose stepfather intends to sell her, and who escapes by secretly getting into Yahya's car. Everything changes with the presence of the girl, and the encounter leads Yahya to a new phase of trying to forget and deny his past.
LINK TRAILER: BARREN Trailer | Triad Jewish Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Babek Aliassa studied cinema at La Fémis in Paris, France before moving to Canada. There, he produced and directed a short film, two documentaries and a feature film, Halal Butcher Shop, all of which were based on the theme of immigration, something which has been central to Babek's work.
CAST: Maxine Denis, Nico Lagarde
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: When her illegal husband is deported from Canada, Bassima, a young Syrian woman, finds herself in a difficult situation, both socially and financially. Desperately looking for a way to bring her husband back, she agrees to become a surrogate mother in exchange for a false passport. However, she soon finds out that she is already pregnant and must give up her own child.
TAGS: Thriller, Global Politics, Social Impact, De/Gendered

DIRECTOR BIO: Duiren Wagua is an Indigenous cinematographer and audio-visual producer from the Gunadule nation of Panama. He has nine years of experience in Panamanian cinema. Bila Burba is his documentary feature debut.
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: The Gunadule, the original inhabitants of northern Panama, reenact their successful uprising in 1925 against the repressive Panamanian government every year. Keeping this past alive is crucial for the preservation of collective identity, because the Gunadule’s autonomy is once again under threat due to the Panamanian government’s sale of parts of their territory.
AWARDS: Audience Award, International Film Festival of Panama 2024
FESTIVAL HISTORY: International Film Festival of Panama, 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Born in Santiago, Chile, Juan Francisco Olea has directed experimental videos and short films, including The Bluff (2009). The Lamb (2014) is his feature film debut, and Bitter Gold is his second feature.
PRODUCER: Felipe Egaña, Daniela Raviola, Francisco Hervé, Moisés Sepúlveda, Juan Bernardo González, Arturo Pereyra, Cristóbal Zapata, Virginia Bogliolo, Tom Schreiber
SCREENPLAY:
Agustín Toscano, Francisco Hervé,
María Luida Furche, Nicolás Wellmann, Moisés Sepúlveda
CAST: Katalina Sánchez, Francisco Melo, Katalina Sánchez, Michael Silva, Daniel Antivilo
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Set in the extinct world of artisan mining in North Chile, this neo-western revolves around the struggles and gradual empowerment of a teenage girl, who is fighting to keep the family business alive against patriarchal structures and the overarching law of the land.
LINK TRAILER: BITTER GOLD / ORO AMARGO by Juan Olea - trailer EN subtitles

DIRECTOR BIO: Choy Ji is a Chinese filmmaker. His films have been selected for the Busan International Short Film Festival as well as the Tampere Film Festival. Borrowed Time is his feature film debut.
CAST: Dongping Lin, Sunny Sun, Eddy Au-Yeung, Pan Jie, Tai-Bo
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Ting is on the brink of marriage, but still wounded by her father’s departure twenty years earlier. Setting out in search of him and for a sense of resolution, she travels from Guangzhou to Hong Kong. There, she meets a childhood friend and, reconnecting over a bootleg CD, Ting delves into her family’s secrets and the emotional turmoil still sharply rooted in her life.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Busan International Film Festival 2023, International Film Festival Rotterdam 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Jianjie received his MFA degree in filmmaking from New York University's Tisch School of the Arts. His short films, A Visit (2015) and Gu (2017), were screened at many international film festivals. Brief History of a Family is his feature film debut.
PRODUCER: Ying Lou, Yue Zheng, Yiwen Wang, Zhou Ping
CAST: Feng Zu, Keyu Guo, Xilun Sun, Lin Muran
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Fifteen-year-old Yan Shuo is injured when hit with a stray basketball by Tu Wei. Apologetic about the accident and sympathetic to the former’s difficult home situation, Wei absorbs Shuo into his bougie existence. But Shuo’s arrival forces everybody to evaluate their lives and reconsider the roles fate has dealt them. The spectre of the one-child policy looms over this atmospheric debut that lays bare China’s widening class divide.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Berlin International Film Festival 2024, Sundance Film Festival 2024, Hong Kong International Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Brazilian filmmaker and composer Marco Dutra grew up obsessed with the horror and fantasy genres. In 2017 his genre bending feature Good Manners, won the Silver Leopard at the Locarno Film Festival.
CAST: Selton Mello, Marjorie Estiano, Danilo Grangheia
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Edgar Wilson, a worker who earns his living by collecting roadkill in rural Brazil, dreams of escaping his drab existence, accompanied by Nete, the love of his life. At the same time that Nete decides to join a dangerous apocalyptic sect, Edgar will embark on a mind-bending journey through a dystopian Brazil.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: BFI London Film Festival 2024, Sitges International Fantastic Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Tumpal is a cinephile-turned-filmmaker, based in Jakarta, Indonesia. Since 2005, he has written and directed numerous short films, several of which were screened in various domestic and international film festivals. In 2009, he was selected to attend the Berlinale Talents in Berlin. Crocodile Tears is his feature film debut.
PRODUCER: Mandy Marahimin, Anthony Chen, Harry Flöter
CAST: Marissa Anita, Yusuf Mahardika, Zulfa Maharani
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Johan is a young man who lives with his Mama on their run-down, scarcely visited crocodile farm in West Java. He never asked for it, but his mother controls his every move. The farm is at the centre of their lives — the crocodiles keep them busy, and the work isolates them from the rest of the world. But the fraught balance of their day-to-day routine is turned upside down when a young woman enters Johan’s life.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Toronto International Film Festival 2024 , BFI London Film Festival 2024, Busan International Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Boris Guts is a Russian experimental filmmaker, and a social activist with a focus on themes like poverty, racism, homophobia, cancer, and AIDS. He is the founder of the international cinema school and film production company Move On. He has directed more than five feature length films.
PRODUCER: Boris Guts, Daria Likhacheva, Maksim Podolski, Maxim Mussel, Anastasiya Gusentsova
CAST: Anastasia Shemyakina, Daniil Gazizullin
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Sonya, a Ukranian, and Danya from Russia meet in Istanbul. They have common problems: they need to find money for food, an apartment and a job. They also have the same desires: to have fun, dance, drink, and have sex. But the main questions are how to deal with the past, arrange their lives and build a joint future.

DIRECTOR BIO: Born in 1988, Dastan Ryskeldi is a Kyrgyzstani filmmaker who studied Theater and Cinema at the Kyrgyz State University of Culture and Arts. His works include A Father’s Will (2016) and The Road to Eden (2020), both of which he codirected with Bakyt Mukul.
CAST: Abylai Marat, Omurbek Izrailov, Meerim Atantaeva, Begaiym Asanakunova, Jenishbek Smanov, Atai Omurbekov, Akylbek Murataliev
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: At the Kyrgyzstan-Kazakhstan border, Aza and Samat work as members of a drug trafficking organization. One day, they run into Nazik, who has narrowly escaped from human traffickers. Aza decides to give up the drug money and save Nazik, but Nazik tragically dies while crossing a river. Aza is determined to at least return Nazik’s remains to her homeland, but his decision thrusts him into even greater danger.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Busan International Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Shankha Das Gupta is a Dhaka-based filmmaker. Since 2007, he has directed numerous fiction and drama series for local television channels and OTT platforms. Dear Maloti is Shankha’s debut feature film.
CAST: Mehazabien Chowdhury, Rizvi Rizu, Shahjahan Shamrat, Azad Abul Kalam
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: In the quiet simplicity of their lives, seven-months pregnant Maloti Rani and sanitary shop salesman Polash Das find solace and love, despite their ongoing hardship. Maloti's world shatters when a mall blast claims her husband Polash in Dhaka, Bangladesh. Unsure of her unborn child's future, she battles her in-laws and society, fighting to prove Polash's accidental death.

DIRECTOR BIO:
Jonathan Vinel began a solo directing career before collaborating with Caroline Poggi on As Long as Shotguns Remain (2014), which was awarded a Golden Bear for Best Short Film at the Berlinale. 

Caroline Poggi studied at the University of Corsica and then graduated from the University of Paris 8. She began a solo directing career before collaborating with Jonathan Vinel on As Long as Shotguns Remain (2014). Their first feature, Jessica Forever (2018), premiered in Toronto and was presented at the Cannes Directors' Fortnight in 2024.
SCREENPLAY:
Caroline Poggi, Jonathan Vinel,
Guillaume Bréaud
CAST: Théo Cholbi, Erwan Kepoa Falé, Lila Gueneau
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH:
Pablo, a small-time dealer, and his teenage sister Apolline have forged an unbreakable bond through their shared obsession with the online video game Darknoon. When Pablo falls for the mysterious Night, he gets swept up in their liaison, abandoning his sister to deal with the impending shutdown of their digital haven alone. As Pablo’s reckless choices provoke the wrath of a dangerous rival gang, the end of their virtual life draws near, upending their
reality.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Cannes Film Festival 2024, BFI London Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Aslı Özarslan studied Theatre and Media studies as well as Philosophy and Sociology. Her documentary films Island 36 and Dil Leyla have won several awards internationally and nationally.
CAST: Melia Kara, Doğa Gürer, Jale Arıkan, Haydar Şahin, Orhan Kiliç
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Hazal’s greatest wish is to have a life. In spite of many applications, she isn’t invited to a single job interview. Instead, she is stuck in a Job Centre training program that fails to open up any new opportunities for her. On her 18th birthday, Hazal and her friends decide to visit a club, but the bouncer refuses to let them in. Hazal's feelings of cultural deracination are compunded when they’re harassed by a local student. The situation escalates, and Hazal’s frustration about all the rejections erupts into a fatal act. Hazal is forced to flee headlong to Istanbul, a strange city in a country unknown to her.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Berlin International Film Festival 2024
TAGS: Films By Women, Global Politics, Thriller, De/Gendered

DIRECTOR BIO: Yang Li was born in 1959 in Xian, China. He is a writer and producer, known for Blind Shaft (2003), Mang shan (2007) and The Taking of Tiger Mountain (2014).
CAST: Ruoyun Zhang, Chuxi Zhong, Yang Song, Chenhao Li, Xiaoliang Wu, Yanmanzi Zhu, Zhengrong Wen
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: After falling into an unknown chemical material, three teenagers discover that they can travel twenty years into the future by sneezing. There, they occupy their adult bodies and observe what has changed over two decades. What seems like a harmless way to pass the time turns out to have unforeseen consequences, which escalate the situation to apocalyptic proportions.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Toronto International Film Festival 2024
LINK TRAILER: escape from the 21st century – Trailer | fantasy filmfest 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Marcia Romano worked as a cashier at the Cinéma Mac-Mahon, took scriptwriting courses, and then collaborated on the writing of numerous films. Meanwhile, Benoît Sabatier met hairy musicians, beardless pop stars, and living legends, as he was a rock critic and published books on the subject. Romano and Sabatier then decided to join forces to make films that were more or less musical.
CAST: Christophe Paou, Roxane Mesquida, Angèle Metzger, John Arnold, Bella Baguena, Venus Yaffa, Rayan Khennouf, Julie Leclerc, Yasmine Neya
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Raoul rushes to Marseille, where his daughter is dead, with nothing but a few names of people she hung out with and addresses of places they went to. Nothing matches: it's all bullshit. As he tries to piece everything back together, he finds out she made a music record with a girl group. He sets out to get the band back together, no matter what it takes.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Cannes Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Sandeep Kumar is an Austrian filmmaker of Indian origin. In 2010 he released the first Austro-Bollywood film Kesariya Balam which received many awards. Servus Ishq, his second film, had a nationwide release and was produced by Oscar winning producer Josef Aichholzer.
CAST: Sahidur Rahaman, Lilian Klebow, Roland Düringer
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Happy revolves around the desperate pursuit of an illegal Indian immigrant in Austria to provide a happy family for his little daughter, while grappling with the repercussions of a deportation notice. In the process, the film also exposes the same yearning for happiness of those who seem to have it all.

DIRECTOR BIO: Majid-Reza Mostafavi started his film career editing and making short films. His humanistic narratives deal with the forgotten class and important but lesser known events. Hard Shell is his third feature film.
CAST: Payman Maadi, Mehran Ghafoorian, Hanieh Tavasoli, Fereshteh Hosseini, Massoud Karamati, Mehdi Hossein Nia
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Leila, a young talented tightrope walker, has been banned from performing due to threats from fanatics and extremists. Since then, she has become a clown in an old circus owned by her father. Samir, a teenage boy, falls in love with Leila and, instead of going to school, aimlessly roams around the circus. Meanwhile, the political and economic problems in Iran are getting worse day by day.

DIRECTOR BIO: Jamshid Narziqulov studied at the Uzbek State Institute of Art and Culture. House is his feature film debut.
CAST: Mohichekhra Islamova, Imona Gayratova, Otabek Sadirov
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: In a quiet village far from civilization, a tragedy occurs: a widow's only son dies because of a dangerous challenge popular among young people. Devastated by the fact that her son's killer has still not been prosecuted, the mother, desirous of revenge, travels to the bustling metropolis, and, in the labyrinths of an unfamiliar city, begins her investigation. As she travels through the metropolis, the woman reexamines her values and rediscovers herself.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Tashkent International Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Dechen Roder is one of the few female filmmakers in Bhutan. She has made several short films which have participated in numerous festivals around the world, including in competition at the Berlinale Shorts in 2015. She is also the co-founder and organizer of Bhutan’s first film festival- Beskop Tshechu.
CAST: Tandin Bidha, Jimmy Wangyal Tshering
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Nima, a Bhutanese school teacher, is accused of appearing in a non-consensual video, in the process losing her job and her boyfriend. Dismayed, she travels to the south of Bhutan in search of her doppelganger. As she becomes entangled in her lookalike’s life, she realizes she might be the only one to solve her doppelganger’s disappearance, and also recover a 'stolen' sacred song.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Tallinn Black Nights Film Festival 2024
TAGS: Films by Women, Social Impact, De/Gendered

DIRECTOR BIO: Aruan Anartayev is a film director and producer based in Central Asia, Kazakhstan. Since 2017, Aruan has worked as an executive producer at the documentary film studio Tihiy Svet in Almaty. Joqtau is his debut feature.
PRODUCER: Aruzhan Dossymkozha, Alexandra Sytnik, Aruan Anartay
CAST: Yermek Shynbolatov, Isbek Abilmazhinov, Irina Balkova, Aydos Auesbay, Rakhilyam Mashurova, Alibek Anartayev
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Darkhan, a young scientist, returns home after a seven-year absence, accompanied by his girlfriend Elena. His grandfather Sagat invites them to join him on a journey to his ancestral homeland far inland. As they embark on this transformative trip, all three must confront the challenges of acceptance and understanding, testing the bonds that connect them.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Locarno Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Leonardo van Dijl is a writer-director based in Belgium. He’s directed the short films Get Ripped (2014), Umpire (2015), and the Festival selection Stephanie (2020). Julie Keeps Quiet is his feature debut.
PRODUCER:
Gilles Coulier, Gilles De Schryver, Roxanne Sarkozi,
Delphine Tomson, Nima Yousefi, Anthony Muir, Kristina Börjeson
CAST:
Tessa Van Den Broeck, Ruth Becquart, Koen De Bouw, Claire Bodson
Laurent Caron
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Julie, a highly promising 15-year-old player at a tennis academy, nervously faces changes in her training program after her longtime coach is put on leave. The reason: allegations about his relationship with a former player who has recently committed suicide. Despite mounting pressure on Julie to share her own experience with her mentor, the taciturn teen directs her focus where she’s always been conditioned to: her game. Yet, whether Julie acknowledges it or not, the unfolding crisis gradually compels her to emerge from the isolation that’s been imposed on her.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Cannes Film Festival 2024, Toronto International Film Festival 2024, BFI London Film Festival 2024, Karlovy Vary International Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Bálint Révész's first feature film Granny Project (2017) received the MDR prize at Dok Leipzig and the Next Generation Award at Taiwan IDFF. Dávid Mikulán(Hungary), has directed multiple short films. KIX( 2024) is his first feature film.
PRODUCER: Viki Réka Kiss, András Pires Muhi, Victor Ede, Bálint Révész
CAST: Sanyi Marku
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Sanyi is a wild and energetic eight-year-old boy who races around the streets of Budapest on his skateboard. The city is his playground, a haven of chaos far away from his family’s cramped one-room apartment. By chance, he meets the young filmmakers Dávid and Bálint on the street, and so begins a long friendship. Over the course of 10 years, ‘KIX’ documents how an innocent eight-year-old boy grows up to become a persecuted enemy of the state.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: CPH:DOX 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Nicolás Pereda was born in Mexico City and holds an MFA in film from York University in Toronto. His films include the features Perpetuum Mobile (09), Summer of Goliath (10), Greatest Hits (12), Killing Strangers (13), The Absent (14), Minotaur (15), My Skin, Luminous (19), and Fauna (20).
CAST: Lázaro G. Rodríguez, Luisa Pardo, Francisco Barreiro, Teresita Sánchez, Gabriel Nuncio,Clarissa Malheiros
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Continuing his longstanding and evolving collaboration with the Mexican theatre collective Lagartijas Tiradas al Sol, the film follows a trio of forty-something friends in Mexico City enmeshed in a tepid yet tender love triangle. As Lázaro, Luisa, and Francisco undertake auditions for a coveted role in the same film, the project director’s unorthodox casting methods lead the friends and lovers to question their aspirations and the roles they inhabit in their daily lives.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Toronto International Film Festival 2024, New York Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Ricardo Valenzuela Pinilla is a Chilean filmmaker, known for Cazador (2015), and Martuca (2017). He founded Delavida Films in 2013, which has since focused on supporting independent Latin American cinema.
EDITOR: Ricardo Valenzuela Pinilla, Benjamín Miranda McLeod
CAST: Patricia Cuyul, Héctor Morales, Mariana Loyola Ruz, Judith Chávez, Antonia Méndez
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Year 1994, Puerto Montt. Technology has recently arrived in the southern part of the country. Margarita, a charismatic and ambitious single mother with a rising career as a seller of mobile phones, travels together with Cucho, her co-worker, to different rural areas of the regional capital in search of clients. This boundless race for connectivity exposes communication conflicts in Margarita’s personal life: she now must deal with her mother, a fanatical singer of Pope John Paul II.

DIRECTOR BIO: Jan Jakub Kolski is a film director, cinematographer, and screenwriter from Poland. He has directed numerous short films and documentaries, and has also made nature films, most of them on cave exploration and mountain climbing.
PRODUCER: Agnieszka Janowska, Jan Jakub Kolski, Aleksandra Michael, Wytwórnia Doświadczalna
CAST: Eryk Lubos, Alicja Stasiewicz, Zuzanna Drobniak, Bartosz Opania, Karolina Rzepa
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Eryk and Karolka are a pair of dreamers. Upon their release from prison, they opt to forge a new, law-abiding life in the tranquility of nature to avoid further conflict with the law. Eryk is also determined to secure happiness for his young daughter, Dżesika, whom he retrieves from her grandfather. Together with Karolka, they embark on a daring journey across Poland. Complications arise when Karolka falls seriously ill, and the only hope for her recovery lies in expensive treatment, which they cannot afford.

DIRECTOR BIO: Jeon Kyu-hwan is a South Korean film director and screenwriter. His film The Weight was the first Korean film to win the 2012 Queer Lion at the 69th Venice International Film Festival.
CAST: Changgil Moon, Inpyo Cha, Euiuk Jeong, Aela Shin
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: The 20 horses that the old man Kim cared for all his life have suddenly disappeared from his pasture on Jeju Island. Kim looks for them for more than a month, but to no avail. One day he hears that illegal immigrants are secretly butchering stolen horses and livestock in the forest to sell their meat. Kim puts together a crackdown squad to raid the forest.

DIRECTOR BIO: Albanian born filmmaker Papas completed his debut feature film Open Door in 2019, winning the Cineuropa Prize and Best Film in Brussels. Papas founded his production company, Tunnelfilm, in 2016 and has since produced short films and co-produced feature films. Luna Park is his second feature film.
PRODUCER: Dritan Huqi, Ioanna Bolomyti, Riccardo Neri
CAST: Adriana Matoshi, Nik Xhelilaj, Flonja Kodheli, Orion Jolldashi, Suela Bako
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: In Albania's post-communist landscape, a lonely mother, Mira, and her troubled teenage son, Toni, struggle through an outbreak of civil violence that threatens to tear their East European nation apart.

TITLE ENGLISH: Me, Maryam, the Children and 26 Others
TITLE ORIGINAL: Man, Maryam, Bacheha Va 26 Nafare Digar/ من، مريم، بچه ها و ٢٦ نفر ديگر
DIRECTOR BIO: Iranian writer, director and actor Farshad Hashemi is considered a crucial artist in the Iranian film and theatre industry, taking up roles both in front of and behind the camera. ME, MARYAM, THE CHILDREN, AND 26 OTHERS is his directorial debut.
CAST: Mahboube Gholami, Farshad Hashemi, Ebrahim Azizi, Zahra Aghapour
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Mahboube, a woman in her early thirties, enjoys a solitary existence. But her world is turned upside down when she lets a film crew into her home for a week-long shoot. First, she sees the objects that comprise her physical life used without thought or care. Then, the filming process affects her on a deeper level, forcing her to come to terms with the ghosts of her past and her place as a woman in Iranian society.
AWARDS:
The Ingmar Bergman International Debut Award, Göteborg Film Festival
2024
FESTIVAL HISTORY: International Film Festival of Rotterdam 2024, Göteborg Film Festival 2024
LINK TRAILER: Me, Maryam, the Children and 26 Others – trailer | IFFR 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Julie Delpy is a Paris-born actor, director, screenwriter, and musician. She has acted in more than 30 films, and written, directed, and starred in the features 2 Days in Paris (07), The Countess (09), Le Skylab (11), 2 Days in New York (12), and the Festival selections Lolo (15) and My Zoe (19).
SCREENPLAY: Julie Delpy, Matthieu Rumani,Nicolas Slomka, Elsa Domenach
CAST: Julie Delpy, Sandrine Kiberlain, Laurent Lafitte, India Hair, Jean-Charles Clichet
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Paimpont sits nestled in Brittany, content with its centuries-old heritage, its crêpes, and its flattering self-image. The town council is delighted they’ll soon be welcoming refugees from Ukraine. But it turns out that too many in France have already taken in Ukrainian refugees, so the van that pulls into Paimpont one day delivers a refugee family from Syria instead. As the extended Fayad family finds its footing in a village very much set in its ways, both townspeople and newcomers must rethink their preconceptions.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Toronto International Film Festival 2024, Festival du Film Francophone 2024
TAGS: Films By Women, Comedy, Global Politics, Festival Hits

DIRECTOR BIO: César Díaz was born in Guatemala in 1978. After studying in Mexico and Belgium, he joins the screenwriting course at La FEMIS in Paris. He has been editing fiction and documentaries for over ten years.
PRODUCER: Delphine Schmit, Géraldine Sprimont, Anne-laure Guégan
CAST: Bérénice Béjo, Matheo Labbé, Leonardo Ortizgris, Julieta Egurrola
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: 1976. Death threats force Maria, a Guatemalan rebel activist fighting against the corrupt military dictatorship, to flee to Mexico, leaving her son behind. 10 years later, when he comes to live with her, she will be forced to choose between her duties as a mother and her revolutionary ideals.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Locarno International Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Swiss-Swedish-German director Sophia Bösch studied Film Directing at Stockholm Academy of Dramatic Arts and Film University Babelsberg. Her graduation short Rå (2018) premiered at the 2018 Berlinale. Milk Teeth (2024) is her debut feature film.
PRODUCER: Jennifer Müller Von Der Haegen, Milena Klemke, Yvonne Wellie, Jakob D. Weydemann
CAST: Susanne Wolff, Ulrich Matthes, Mathilde Bundschuh, Lola Dockhorn, Karin Neuhäuser
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Skalde lives in a small rural community, far from a world that may no longer exist. She is an interloper in her own home, having been born to an ‘outsider’ mother and therefore marked by a social stigma she cannot easily erase. Displaying a loyalty to the codes of the community, she has earned the respect of the village elder. However, when she encounters a mysterious girl in the local woods, Skalde risks everything by befriending her.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: International Film Festival Rotterdam 2024

TITLE ORIGINAL: Wo De Peng You an De Lie
DIRECTOR BIO: Dong Zijian is a veteran Chinese actor, with experience of more than ten years in film and television. My Friend An Delie is Dong’s feature film debut.
CAST: Dong ZiJian, Liu HaoRan, Chi Xingkai, Han Haolin, Yin Tao, Dong Baoshi
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Li Mo and An De Lie, who have very different personalities, become friends thanks to soccer. However, an accident makes An Lie disappear from Li Mo's memory along with his youthful past. Years later, Li Mo 'reunites' with An De Lie on the way to his father's funeral, and a dusty memory is gradually uncovered.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Tokyo International Film Festival 2024
Drive Link to Press Kit: 《我的朋友安德烈》电影节海报-英文版v2.jpg

DIRECTOR BIO: Hiroshi Okuyama is a director, screenwriter, cinematographer, and editor from Tokyo. He’s directed the short films Graduationparty!!!!! (09), The Swan Smiles (18), and Tokyo 21st October (18) and the feature film Jesus (18).
CAST: Sosuke Ikematsu, Keitatsu Koshiyama, Kiara Nakanishi
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: On a small Japanese island, life revolves around the changing seasons. Winter is time for ice hockey at school, but Takuya isn’t too thrilled about it. His real interest lies in Sakura, a figure skating rising star from Tokyo, for whom he starts to develop a genuine fascination. Coach and former champion Arakawa, spots potential in Takuya, and decides to mentor him to form a duo with Sakura for an upcoming competition. As winter persists, feelings grow, and the two children form an harmonious bond. But even the first snow eventually melts away.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Cannes Film Festival 2024, Toronto International Film Festival 2024, San Sebastian Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Gürcan Keltek studied film at Dokuz Eylül University before directing several shorts. His medium-length film Colony (2015) was screened at FIDMarseille. His first feature film, Meteorlar (2017), won more than 20 awards and was screened at many international film festivals, including Rotterdam, BAFICI, Viennale, Bordeaux, Fajr, and Hong Kong.
CAST: Cem Yiğit Üzümoğlu, Ayla Algan, Erol Babaoğlu, Suzan Kardeş, Dilan Düzgüner, Gürkan Gedikli
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Akın has been in and out of the hospital, stuck in the system for years. He no longer leaves his family house except for occasional visits to religious monuments in Istanbul. Trying to find refuge in God, he gradually falls into a state of ecstasy. The divine structures trigger something in him, and as he loses touch with his true self, his mind shifts into another reality.
AWARDS: Best Feature Boccalino d’Oro Award of the Independent Film Critics, Locarno International Film Festival 2024
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Locarno International Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Marcos Pimentel is a director, screenwriter and independent producer. Marcos Pimentel has made several creative documentaries that have won prizes at national and international film festivals, and has had his work exhibited at over 700 festivals all over the world.
CAST: Bárbara Colen, Lavínia Castelari, Sinara Teles, Adyr Assumpção, Lucas Oranmia
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Oysters Silence follows the life of a girl, born in a village of workers who work in a mining camp. After her mother disappears without explanation, she has to learn to deal with the successive losses that life has in store for her. With the end of mining in the region, the place turns into a ghost town, and with nowhere to go, she and her inseparable dog are the only ones who don't leave the place. When loneliness seems to have reached its peak, a dam burst suddenly decimates the village.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Rio De Janeiro International Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Mahesh Pailoor is an award winning filmmaker based in Los Angeles. Raised in a seaside town in Maine to immigrant Indian parents, Mahesh’s films often grapple with divergent notions of South Asian identity. His work has been championed at festivals and institutions, including SXSW, Cannes Lions and the Smithsonian.
CAST: Karan Soni, Kapil Talwalkar, Olivia Liang, Tom Everett Scott, Faran Tahir, Meera Simhan
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: After graduating from USC, Shalin Shah sets off for Peru with the Peace Corps, leaving behind his tight-knit family and high school sweetheart. But his dreams of changing the world are shattered when a routine check-up reveals a devastating diagnosis: a rare and aggressive cancer.
LINK TRAILER: Paper Flowers - Official First Movie Trailer - 2'30"

DIRECTOR BIO:
Carmen Jaquier studied filmmaking and screenwriting at the École Cantonale d’Art de Lausanne. Her graduation film The Girl’s Grave won the Pardino d’argento at the Locarno Film Festival. Jan Gassmann
Jan Gassmann's documentary Chris screened in the Berlinale Forum in 2007, while his 2011 debut feature film Off Beat and his 2016 documentary Europe, She Loves were both selected for Panorama.
PRODUCER: Lisa Blatter, Carole Le Page, Jan Gassmann
CAST: Dorothée De Koon, Aurore Clément, Roland Bonjour
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: On a winter’s evening, a woman wanders through the busy streets of Benidorm. Diane is alone, with only a bag from the pharmacy in her arms. She has left behind Martin and her newborn baby at the women’s clinic in Zurich. In the glow of the neon signs, Diane seems like a shadow moving to the beat of the city – a mediterranean Las Vegas in decline. In this parallel world of all-inclusive tourists, revelers and eccentrics, Diane meets Rose. Without many words, these two strangers find their way to each other, a mutual adoption of two lonely souls.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Berlin International Film Festival 2024, Locarno International Film Festival 2024
LINK TRAILER: Paradises Of Diane': first trailer for Berlin Panorama film (exclusive)

DIRECTOR BIO: Marcelo Gomes studied journalism, with a specialization in TV. His films have screened at major international festivals including Cannes, Venice, Berlin, and Sundance.
PRODUCER: Mariana Ferraz, Ernesto Soto, Fabiano Gullane, Eliane Ferreira, Guilherme Coelho, Tatiana Leite, Simone Gattoni
SCREENPLAY: Marcelo Gomes, Gustavo Campos, Maria Camargo
CAST: Charbel Kamel, Wafa Celine Halawi, akaria Al Kaakour, Eros Galbiati, Rosa Peixoto
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: In the late 1940s, a devastating conflict takes place in Lebanon. Catholic sister and brother Emilie and Emir decide to leave for Brazil. On board the ship to their new home, Emilie falls in love with Omar, a Muslim trader. For an angry and jealous Emir, the relationship is intolerable. Emir's actions and Emilie's subsequent decision - unfolding against the backdrop of the majestic rainforest - will now lead to disastrous consequences.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: International Film Festival of Rotterdam 2024
LINK TRAILER: Portrait of a Certain Orient – trailer | IFFR 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Natalia graduated from GITIS with an acting course, and made her directorial debut in 2012 with the film "Daughter", which won the FIPRESCI prize at the Warsaw International Film Festival. She lives and works in Moscow.
CAST: Alina Khojevanova, Maxim Stoyanov, Irina Nosova, Ilya Noskov
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Yana works at the post office, where she collects stamps and hopes for her father to come back from the sea. Despite having cerebral palsy, Yana is a strong person, and her slight limp only adds to her charm. One day the sailor Petr visits the post office, bearing news that will forever change Yana's life.

DIRECTOR BIO: After studying literature, history of art and psychology, and training in contemporary dance, Mareike collaborated with choreographers in multimedia shows and made her first short films. Rabia is her feature debut.
PRODUCER: Lionel Massol, Pauline Seigland, Wasiliki Bleser, Annabella Nezri
CAST: Megan Northam, Lubna Azabal, Natacha Krief
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Jessica, a 19-year-old French girl leaves her country for Syria, thinking that the humiliations of cheap labor will give way to a life of leisure in the villa showed owned by her friend’s future husband, an ISIS fighter. But in lieu of the handsome groom in the pictures, what they find in Raqqa is a locked house full of other young women from around the world. In order to survive, she becomes an assistant to the iron-fisted director, Madame, who exerts a powerful fascination over her. How far beyond the limits of her conviction will Rabia accept to go?
LINK TRAILER: RABIA Bande Annonce (2024) Megan Northam - YouTube

DIRECTOR BIO: Jayan Cherian, from Kerala, holds an MFA in filmmaking from The City College of New York as well as a BA in film and creative writing from Hunter College. His feature films include Ka Bodyscapes (2016), Papilio Buddha (2014), and The Shape of the Shapeless (2010).
CAST: Chinmaya Siddi, Prashant Siddi, Girija Siddi, Parashuram Siddi, Nagaraj Siddi, Mohan Siddi,Shantram Siddi
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Jayaram Siddi, a twelve-year-old boy, lives in a village in Uttara Kannada, possessed by the spirit of his recently deceased grandpa, Rama Bantu Siddi. His working-class parents, Bhaskar Siddi and Yashoda Siddi, are worried and seek a solution from local black magicians and medicine men, but nothing helps alleviate his condition. Caught up in the tangle of the intergenerational trauma of chattel slavery, Jayaram gradually loses his grip on reality.

COUNTRY: Democratic Republic of the Congo, Belgium, Germany, Burkina Faso, Qatar
DIRECTOR BIO: Nelson Makengo is a Congolese director, visual artist and producer whose work oscillates between contemporary art and cinema. Rising Up At Night is his first feature film.
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Darkness falls over Kinshasa, the capital of the Democratic Republic of the Congo, and its 17 million inhabitants. It is just before Christmas and people are struggling to gain access to electric light. Kudi is mobilising the residents of his Kisenso neighbourhood to collect money for a new power cable. On Mount Mangengenge, a holy place overlooking the city, Pastor Gédéon delivers a sermon about the light of Christ as the path to life and truth. Davido is searching for a place to stay after his house was flooded by the Congo River. Together with other young men, he kills time by working out and dreams of a better future.
AWARDS: Winner: Special Jury Award in the International Feature Film Section,Visions du Reel
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Berlin International Film Festival 2024, BFI London Film Festival 2024, Visions du Reel 2024
LINK TRAILER: RISING UP AT NIGHT trailer | BFI London Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Born and raised in Dortmund, Yasemin Şamdereli studied at the University of Television and Film in Munich. Her graduation film, KISMET, was shown at several major film festivals and won the Short Tiger Award at IFFR. Samia is her second feature film.
PRODUCER:
Simone Catania, Dietmar Güntsche, Anja-karina Richter, Michele Fornasero,
Francesca Portalupi, Martin Rohé, Joseph Rouschop, Riccardo Russo, David Herdies, Michael Krotkiewski, Iman Ismail, Christoph Fisser
SCREENPLAY: Yasemin Samdereli, Nesrin Samdereli, Giuseppe Catozzella
CAST: Ilham Mohamed Osman, Fathia Mohamed Absie, Fatah Ghedi, Elmi Rashid Elmi, Waris Dirie
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Samia is an assertive, independent young woman growing up in a place that isn’t very welcome to young women who are independent and assertive. Raised in a Mogadishu, Somalia torn asunder by civil war, all that young Samia wants to do is run. Despite the harassment from local militias saying women shouldn’t be involved in sports, running is a bright spot in her tumultuous life. Training in a deserted stadium, on a track pockmarked by mortars, she is determined to go to the Olympics like her hero, Mo Farah. That determination pays off when, at the age of 17, she’s selected to represent her country at the 2008 Beijing Olympics. She returns to Africa with an even brighter flame burning to go to the 2012 Olympics in London. But circumstances have changed, and the path toward fulfilling her dreams is not the one she’d anticipated.
AWARDS: Special Mention: International Narrative Feature, Tribeca Film Festival 2024
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Tribeca Film Festival 2024
TAGS: Films By Women, Social Impact, De/Gendered

TITLE ENGLISH: Sleep Still With Your Eyes Open
DIRECTOR BIO: Nele Wohlatz is a script writer, director and visual artist from Germany. Her feature film El Futuro Perfecto (2016) won the Golden Leopard for the best first feature at Locarno IFF.
PRODUCER: Emilie Lesclaux, Kleber Mendonça Filho, Justine O., Roger Huang, Violet Bava, Rosa Martínez Rivero, Meike Martens, Nele Wohlatz
CAST: Chen Xiao Xin, Wang Shin-hong, Liao Kai Ro, Nahuel Pérez Biscayart, Lu Yang Zong
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: A coastal city in Brazil. Kai arrives on holiday from Taiwan with a broken heart. A malfunctioning air conditioner leads her to end up in Fu Ang’s umbrella shop. He could become a friend, but then the rainy season fails to arrive and the shop closes. While searching for Fu Ang, Kai comes across Xiao Xin and a group of Chinese workers in a fancy high-rise building. Kai finds herself strangely mirrored in Xiao Xin’s story. Over the course of a hot, slow summer, delicate bonds grow between them like islands in a sea full of sharks.
AWARDS: Winner: FIPRESCI Prize, Berlin International Film Festival 2024
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Berlin International Film Festival 2024. San Sebastián International Film Festival 2024
LINK TRAILER: Sleep with Your Eyes Open (2024) | MUBI

COUNTRY: Bolivia, Chile, Mexico, France, Ecuador, Italy
DIRECTOR BIO: Vinko Tomičić Salinas is a Chilean screenwriter, director and producer. His solo feature debut, The Dog Thief, was developed at the Cannes Cinefondation Residency and the Venice Biennale College Cinema program.
PRODUCER: Alvaro Manzano Zambrana, Gabriela Maire, Edher Campos, Vinko Tomičić Salinas, Matias de Bourguignon
CAST: Alfredo Castro, Franklin Aro, Teresa Ruiz, María Luque, Julio César Altamirano, Ninón Dávalos
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Set in the Bolivian capital of La Paz, The Dog Thief centers on young teenager Martin, a shoeshine boy working on the city streets. While he has a room in a large, old house courtesy of his late mother’s close friend, he is an orphan with few friends and fewer avenues to support himself. But hope exists in the form of Martin’s best client, Mr. Novoa, a lonely tailer whose sole friend is Astor, a beautiful German Shepherd he cares for like a son. Initially motivated by a possible reward, Martin steals Astor. But as Martin and Mr. Novoa spend more time together, a bond develops that neither anticipates.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Tribeca Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Roman Bondarchuk is a Ukrainian director. He has directed short films, documentaries, music videos and the feature film Volcano (2018), which premiered at the Karlovy Vary International Film Festival.
SCREENPLAY: Dar'ya Averchenko, Alla Tyutyunik, Roman Bondarchuk
CAST: Dmytro Bahnenko, Zhanna Ozirna, Rymma Ziubina, Andrii Kyrylchuk
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: In the wild steppes of Southern Ukraine, a young nature researcher named Yura, looking for an endangered species of groundhog, instead witnesses a crime. Eager to expose the truth, Yura takes his photo evidence to the local newspaper's editorial office. However, he quickly realizes that nobody there cares about pursuing justice. While a big war is looming over the horizon, Yura's naive worldview is sundered in a storm of fake news, rigged political elections, and mysterious cult rituals.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Berlin International Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Goran Radovanovi is a well-known Serbian filmmaker, with a background in Cinema and Philosophy. His films have been screened and awarded at numerous film festivals worldwide.
CAST: Sara Klimoska, Vojin Cetkovic, Miloš Biković
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Sava, an eight year old boy caught in the middle of the bombing of Serbia in 1999, goes on a journey of survival with his mother, while trying to maintain his unspoiled, naive worldview.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Moscow International Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: David Oelhoffen is a French filmmaker and screenwriter. His films - The Last Men (2023), Close Enemies (2018), and Far From Men (2014) - have been screened at major festivals.
CAST: Lauren Lafitte, Manal Issa, Simon Abkarian
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Lebanon, 1982. To keep a promise made to an old friend, Georges, an idealistic theater director, travels to Beirut for a project as utopian as it is risky: to stage the play Antigone on the front line, in order to steal a moment of peace from the raging civil war. The characters will be played by actors from different political and religious camps. Lost in a city and a conflict he knows nothing about, Georges is guided by Marwan. As fighting resumes, everything is soon called into question, and Georges, who falls in love with Imane, has to face up to the reality of war.

DIRECTOR BIO: David P. Sañudo is a director, screen-player and producer based in Bilbao. In 2020, David premièred his first full-length feature Ane in the New Directors section of the San Sebastian International Film Festival, which won the Irizar Award. He has also won three Goya Awards.
CAST: Miren Gaztañaga, Maica Barroso, Ion Zumelaga
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Irune, an insecure, lonely woman with hypochondriac tendencies, works in a paper factory on the suburbs of an industrial town in Àlava. Her life is limited to a small circle of acquaintances: her workmates, a neighbour with whom she shares something resembling a friendship and a Renfe train operator with whom she consults train timetables that she never takes. Her fragile equilibrium will explode when she detects a lump in her breast, which coincides with a labour conflict in which she is involved. It is then that her life takes an unexpected turn, offering her the opportunity that, perhaps unknowingly, she had always been waiting for.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: San Sebastian International Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Emmanuel Courcol is a French actor, director, and screenwriter. The Marching Band is his third feature film.
CAST: Benjamin Lavernhe, Pierre Lottin, Sarah Suco, Jacques Bonnaffe
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Thibaut is an internationally renowned conductor who travels the world. When he learns he was adopted, he discovers the existence of a younger brother, Jimmy, who works in a school cafeteria and plays the trombone in a small marching band. Everything seems to set them apart, except their love of music. Sensing his brother's exceptional talent, Thibaut decides to remedy the injustice of fate.
AWARDS: Audience Award, San Sebastian Film Festival 2024
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Cannes Film Festival 2024, San Sebastian International Film Festival 2024
LINK TRAILER: The Marching Band / En fanfare (2024) - Clip 1 (English subs)

DIRECTOR BIO: Rastislav Boroš is a Slovak screenwriter, director, and producer. In 2015, his debut feature Stanko was released, and in 2022 he followed it up with Goldilocks And The Glorious Losers. The Sluggard Clan is his third feature film.
CAST: Milan Ondrík, Milan Mikulčík, Samuel Teicher, Anežka Petrová
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Somewhere in the hills of central Slovakia three brothers live, lost in time, dreams, naïveté and folly, blurring the boundaries between the real world and that of their late ancestors. The only thing that conveys a sense to their futile lives is a cobweb of tragicomic relationships with their fateful women ready to give up their lives for love. An allegorical fresco about love beyond the grave where the poetics of magical realism confronts the Nazi and Communist past of the Slovak nation.

DIRECTOR BIO: Khusnora Rozmatova is a film director from Uzbekistan. She received international recognition after winning the “For Humanism” award at the 19th Kazan International Muslim Film Festival. The Song Sustxotin is her second feature film.
CAST: Karim Mirkhadiyev, Egamberdi Rakhimov, Munisa Magamed, Shukhrat Shokirov
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: In a distant village, a merciless drought reigns. The villagers perform ancient rituals to find a way out of the scourge and misery, but to no avail. During such perilous times, Ahbor, a former official, goes to the village in search of a friend, and encounters an unexpected case: an underage girl who has been raped.

DIRECTOR BIO: Rodrigo Quintero Arauz was born in David, Chiriquí, Panamá. He is a director and writer, known for Estanislao (2021), Me Dicen El Panzer (2024) and Papeles.
CAST: Orlando Alexis Ortíz, Eloris Yamirelis Lastra Rivera, Priscilla Liztel Lopez Ramos
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Panama, 1986. At 17 years old, Rommel, who everyone calls big-headed, walks through the streets kicking an empty milk carton, daydreaming about playing soccer. But Mélida, his mother, pressures him to look for work, while caring for and taking care of his sister Jackeline, while she makes a living selling fried foods on the streets of Chorrillo. The mini league is approaching, and Rommel is working tirelessly for a spot on the Pampers. From being called big-headed, he will become the Panzer of football, of his family and of everyone. A film inspired by the life of Rommel Fernández Gutiérrez, the great legend of Panamanian and Tenerife football.

DIRECTOR BIO: Dr Vukčević is a prominent Montenegrin film and theatre director. He has directed three feature films, including Montenegro’s official candidate for the Oscars in 2014. He has also directed one full-length documentary and over 80 advertising campaigns.
PRODUCER: Nikola I. Vukcevic, Milorad Radenovic, Nevena Savic, Ivica Vidanovic
CAST: Edon Rizvanolli, Xhejlana Terbunja, Selman Jusufi, Elez Adzovic
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: World War II is underway in Yugoslavia. A child, fleeing from the fascist unit that killed the child's parents and burned their village, finds temporary shelter in the house of a stranger. The host of the house is confronted by a profound moral dilemma: whether to hand over the child to the persecutors, or to endanger the safety of his own family by protecting a foreigner of another religion and nation.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Cairo International Film Festival 2024
TAGS: Historical, Coming of Age, Global Politics

DIRECTOR BIO: Mara Tamkovich is a Polish-Belarusian director and scriptwriter, who has also studied Journalism. Her short films have been shown at numerous festivals in Poland and abroad, and have also received awards.
CAST: Valentin Novopolskij, Aliaksandra Vaitsekhovic
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Belarus, 2020. Mass protests follow the elections rigged by Lukashenko. Anti-regime journalist Lena livestreams the brutal crackdown of a peaceful demonstration and is later tracked down by a police drone and arrested. Lena and her husband Ilya must now face unbearable choices in an attempt to survive and remain true to themselves, in the process confronting a regime determined to break them both.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Tribeca Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Damian Kocur is a writer, director, and cinematographer who was born in Katowice, Poland. His credits as a director include the short films Lesson (13), The Return (16), and As It Was (23), and the feature Bread and Salt (22). Under the Volcano (24) is his second feature film.
CAST: Sofia Berezovska, Roman Lutskyi, Anastasiya Karpenko
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: At the foot of Mount Teide on the Spanish island of Tenerife, a Ukrainian family of four including father Roman, stepmother Anastasiia, teenage daughter Sofiia, and young Fedir are on vacation. Enjoying their final beach day, they are blissfully unaware that, soon, their return flight to Kyiv will be cancelled in the wake of escalating tensions with Russia. From one day to the next, they are no longer tourists but refugees – trapped on a paradisiacal island. Showing us the effects of war without featuring any battle scenes, Under The Volcano is an expertly crafted portrait of a family coping with events out of their control.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Toronto International Film Festival 2024, BFI London Film Festival 2024

TITLE ENGLISH: Vera and the Pleasure of Others
TITLE ORIGINAL: Vera Y El Placer De Los Otros
DIRECTOR BIO: Federico Actis is a director, screenwriter, and producer at Pez Cine. He directed the fiction short film ‘The Cable Cars’ and the documentary feature ‘The Architecture of Crime'. Romina Tamburello is an actress, screenwriter, and director. Romina wrote and directed the documentary series ‘Catalina, The Woman With The Flag’ for Encuentro Channel.
CAST: Luciana Grasso, Inés Estevez, David Zoela
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: 17-year-old Vera divides her days between volleyball, school, and a secret hobby: she rents out an empty apartment to teenagers looking for a place to have sex. She steals the keys from her distracted mother, who manages different properties, and organises everything. The teenagers come and go, using the apartment for a few uninterrupted hours. Playing invisible, Vera stays behind the closed door, her own sexual desires unfolding as she listens to other people’s pleasure.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Tallinn Nights Film Festival 2023

DIRECTOR BIO: Narine Mkrtchyan was born in 1960 in Yerevan, USSR [now Armenia]. She is a director and writer known for Bobo (1991), Radio Yerevan (1992), and Anarak vordu veradardz (2008). Arsen Azatian is an Armenian filmmaker, best known for films like Radio Yerevan (1993), The Return of The Prodigal Son (2008), and The Glass Trinket (2012).
CAST: Armen Abelyan, Arman Mejlumyan, Rudik Hayrapetyan
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: This is a philosophical essay – a reflection on the present of post-war Armenia, where reality and imagination have blended into each other, where the people are desperately seeking “saviors”. In this situation, the creative embodiment of Don Quixote, who appears in this film, proves that there is a very thin border between reality and imagination, and all one needs to do is believe.

DIRECTOR BIO: Emir Kapetanovic is a Bosnian award-winning director based in Los Angeles. He has created socially engaged films, plays, cabarets, web series, hip-hop videos, street performances and stand-up comedy shows. When Santa is his fourth feature film.
CAST: Mirvad Kurić, Zana Marjanović, Miraj Grbić, Mirza Tanović, Kristen Winters
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: December 2023. An acting troupe is going on tour with a play about Santa Claus to spread holiday cheer in the small towns of post-war Bosnia and Herzegovina. While the children are delighted, the appearance of Santa reignites old conflicts between the adults.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Sarajevo Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Laura has written and directed several internationally acclaimed short films and documentaries including the Teledoc Campus, Prove me wrong, and the short films Nymphet and Amantea. The White Flash is Laura Hermanides’ debut feature film.
CAST: Renée Soutendijk, Raymond Thiry, Sanne den Hartogh
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: The hardest thing for a parent is to lose a child. But what if your child is suffering a long and torturous history of psychiatric illness and is just granted permission for his self-long-desired euthanasia? White Flash follows the journey of Aagje and Toon in the last six weeks leading up to the death of their 42-year-old son Rick, in which they try to let him go as the most extreme expression of their love.
PREMIERE: International Premiere, Asia Premiere, India Premiere

DIRECTOR BIO: Charmi Chheda is an Indian writer, filmmaker and theater director. She has conceptualized, directed and choreographed more than 35 productions in the last 10 years, and has also made 3 feature films.
CAST: Tashi Yoedsel Wangchuk, Tandin Bidha, Tshering Denkar, Kinga Dorji
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Jimmy, an American Bhutanese food anthropology student, returns to Bhutan after twenty years. His mother, Jane, once ran the pioneering restaurant Pelbue before abruptly leaving Bhutan with Jimmy, but without her stepdaughter, Yangchen. Jane's sudden departure has left behind scars. Yangchen, his stepsister, feeling abandoned, grew up a loner, and found solace in Bhutan’s landscapes. Back in Bhutan, Jimmy stays with his friend Angay and attempts to reconnect with the now distant Yangchen.

DIRECTOR BIO: Manuela Irene is a Mexican/Colombian filmmaker. In 2013, she participated in Cine Qua Non Lab and the Project Development Workshop at IBERMEDIA. Monstruo de Xibalba is her feature debut.
PRODUCER: Daniel Loustaunau, Damián Aguilar, Manuela Irene
EDITOR: Liora Spilk, Manuela Irene, Federico Veiroj
CAST: Gibrán Alonzo, Leonel Pat Yeh, Manuel Irene, Rogelio Ojeda, Socorro Loeza, Teresa Sánchez
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Rogelio is 8. His parents are never around, and he gets his best birthday gifts from his dentist. This summer he’s sent away to his nanny’s hometown, nestled in the jungle of Yucatán. Rogelio spends the excruciatingly hot days obsessing over “The Book of Spirits” which awakens in him visions and dreams of ghosts, but above all, of an old man who leaves a trace of death when passing by. Rogelio begins to spy on the 'Xibalba monster', and embarks on an adventure that will forever change his views on life and death.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Edinburgh International Film Festival 2024
TAGS: Films By Women, Coming of Age

DIRECTOR BIO: Noaz Deshe works as a director, DOP and musician. His debut feature film White Shadow, about the hunting of a young Albino, won the Lion of the Future Award at the Venice Film Festival and was also showcased at Sundance Film Festival. XOFTEX is his second feature film.
CAST: Abdulrahman Diab, Osama Hafiry, Mohamad Al Rashi, Amal Omran, Jalal Albaroudi, Lujain Mustafa
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Palestinian-Syrian teenager Nasser and his older brother Yassin have been living in a Greek refugee camp, awaiting a decision on their asylum application. They pass the time recording comedy sketches, fantasizing of making zombie films and moving to Sweden. Nasser, however, feels increasingly trapped in this no-man’s-land. With nowhere to escape, boiling tensions in the camp push Nasser into a surreal and disorienting world.
AWARDS: Special Jury Mention, Karlovy Vary 2024
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Karlovy Vary International Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Aislinn Clarke is an Irish writer and director. She holds the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences Gold Fellowship for Women. She is also the first Irish woman to have made a horror feature film, The Devil's Doorway (2018).
CAST: Clare Monnelly, Bríd Ní Neachtain, Aleksandra Bystrzhitskaya
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Haunted by a personal tragedy, home care worker Shoo is sent to a remote village to care for an agoraphobic woman who fears the neighbours as much as she fears the Na Sídhe – sinister entities who she believes abducted her decades before. As the two develop a strangely deep connection, Shoo is consumed by the old woman’s paranoia, rituals, and superstitions, eventually confronting the horrors from her own past.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Locarno Film Festival 2024, BFI London Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Guillermo Barreira is a Spanish flmmaker based in New York City. He has directed two indie feature flms: The Invisible Worm (2017) and Edgar (2022).
PRODUCER: Helion Ramalho, Raúl Cerezo, Guillermo Barreira
CAST: Sara Jiminez, Angela Arellano, Lara Boed, Oti Manzano, Magdalena Broto, Martina Pérez
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Sofia tells the story of young Sofia who embarks on a quest for answers following her mother’s mysterious death, only to uncover a chilling truth that leads her to a face to face with the devil himself. Inspired by the haunting baroque atmosphere of 70 ́s horror classics like “Suspiria” and “Carrie”, Sofia, The Possession promises to be a thrilling journey into the depths of horror.

DIRECTOR BIO: Madrid-based filmmaker Pedro studied cinematography before getting into directing. After graduating he moved quickly into big, award-winning commercials where he garnered attention for his unique visual style. The Wailing is his debut feature film.
PRODUCER: Eduardo Villanueva, Nacho Lavilla, Cristina Zumárraga, Fernanda del Nido, Juampa Miller, Jeròme Vidal, Pablo E. Bossi
CAST: Ester Exposito, Mathilde Ollivier, Malena Villa, Àlex Monner
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Something is haunting Andrea, but no one, not even she herself, knows what it is. Twenty years ago, ten thousand kilometers away, the same presence terrorized Marie. Camila too experienced it, and was the only person who could understand what was happening, but no one believed her. All three encounter the same thing: a strange and terrifying wailing.
AWARDS:
Silver Shell for Best Director, San Sebastián International Film Festival
2024
