DIRECTOR BIO: Mladen Đorđević was born in Belgrade, Serbia. He has directed the features Glad (2002) and The Life and Death of a Porno Gang (2009), part of the omnibus film Equals (2014), and the documentaries Made in Serbia (05) and Vienna Hallways (2020).
CAST: Tamara Krcunovic, Leon Lucev, Momo Picuric
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Five years after a factory fire claimed the lives of several workers and, with them, the primary livelihood of a rural Balkan town, the plant’s union is met with a debilitating blow in their fight for reparations. Long suspected of causing the fire in order to privatize their property, the owners have succeeded in evading legal consequence and the workers are cast as ungrateful nuisances, obstinate in the face of capitalistic progress. Stoic labour leader Ceca refuses to give up hope, but her position grows tenuous when the collective begins to develop a fascination with the pagan practices of its newest member, Mija. After Mija leads the union in a ritual that belies a satanic undertone, strange occurrences begin to be reported around town, including the enigmatic manifestation of a decrepit man, seen stalking the most corrupt citizens.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Toronto International Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: David Baute is currently the artistic director of the MiradasDoc Documentary Film Festival. His films –Ella(s) (2010), La murga, opera popular (2014), Milagros (2018), and Climate Exodus (2020)– have been selected in various national and international festivals.
PRODUCER: Edmon Roch, David Baute, Marc Sabe,César Zelada
CAST: Laura Gómez, Bella Agossou, Miranda Gas
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Tanit migrates with her children from the dry, uninhabitable region of Turkana to Nairobi. In India, Shaila leaves her small island of Ghoramara, which is shrinking due to rising sea levels, to work as a housekeeper in Dubai. And Valeria flies with her children to Paris after a hurricane destabilizes life on the French island of Saint Martin. All three women are hoping for a better life, but in their new environments are forced to deal with various forms of exploitation. Focusing on climate refugees who have lost everything due to global warming, Black Butterflies is a radical and affecting call for change.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Sitges International Film Festival 2024, Annecy International Animation Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Bohdan Sláma is one of the major talents of Czech cinema. His films –The Wild Bees (2001), Something Like Happiness (2005), Country Teacher (2008), and Four Suns (2012)– have played and won awards at major international film festivals.
PRODUCER: Pavel Strnad, Petr Oukropec, Marko Škop, Ján Meliš
CAST: Dorota Šlajerová, Tomas Sean Pšenička, Magdaléna Borová, Martin Pechlát, Marek Daniel
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: A quaint Czech village. Verdant fields surround a small farm where fifty-year-old Josef farms with his wife Eva and three children. Josef tries to live an alternative life and leads a Don Quixote-like struggle against the local agribusiness owned by Viktor, for whom the land is just a tool for profit. Victor shares a turbulent relationship with his recently returned son, a climate activist. As the dry summer reaches its peak, the village runs out of drinking water, leading to escalating tensions between the two families.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Galway Film Fleadh 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Matthew Wolkow is a filmmaker and visual artist. His works have been screened in important festivals and alternative settings across the globe. Jean-Jacques Martinod is a media artist, film curator, abyssological researcher, and clandestine anarchivist whose work has been showcased in leading festivals, museums and cinematheques. Eastern Anthems is their first feature.
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH:
An unfinished film is passed along from one friend to another. The dialog between them is a journey crossed by the swarming of the Great Eastern Brood X of periodical cicadas that prophetically emerge every 17 years in the United States, invoking a reflection of a post-pandemic present and our shared futures.
A road movie composed of a chorus of voices (both human and non-human), the warnings of history, and the power of nature and rebirth.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Camden International Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Miguel is a visual artist from Cusco, Peru. His short animation ‘And That is How The Rivers Came to Be’ was screened at more than 20 international film festivals. Stephanie has lived and worked in Peru for 27 years. Her documentaries have screened at over 100 international film festivals.
PRODUCER: Mariluz Canaquiri Murayari, Stephanie Boyd, Leonardo Tello Imaina
SCREENPLAY: Leonardo Tello Imaina, Miguel Araoz Cartagena, Stephanie Boyd
CAST: Mariluz Canaquiris
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Deep in Peru’s Amazon region, the Marañón River is home to a vast network of spirit villages ruled by the Karuara, or “People of the River.” Through enchanting hand-painted animation, we are transported inside their river world and its elaborate cosmogony. But old ways are being forgotten and the indigenous people now face cultural genocide. In a world that continuously puts a price tag on nature and humanizes the corporations responsible for the cultural genocide that is taking place, a federation of women resolutely decides to fight back.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Hot Docs International Documentary Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Mojtaba Bahadori is a filmmaker, photographer, and visual artist. His background in cinema and gemology informs his unique exploration of the natural world, reflecting his deep connection to both nature and the human experience.
CAST: Sophie Cauvin
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Our earth is constantly undergoing changes, with humans often accelerating and disrupting its natural progression. Each landscape reflects a memory of our planet, memories that have been cruelly divided by man-made political borders. For the past 33 years, Sophie Cauvin has been on a journey to engage with these transformed landscapes and reunite these fragmented memories through her art creations.
AWARDS: United Nations Climate Change Prize 2024
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Film Fest Tuscon 2024, United Nations Climate Change Conference 2024

DIRECTOR: Eryk Rocha, Gabriela Carneiro Da Cunha
DIRECTOR BIO: Eryk Rocha is a filmmaker from Brazil. His films have played and won awards at festivals such as Cannes, Sundance, Venice, Locarno, and Rotterdam. Gabriela Carneiro da Cunha is a Brazilian filmmaker and researcher, whose work has been presented at Wiener Festwochen, Festival d'Automne and Centre Georges Pompidou in Paris. The Falling Sky is her debut feature.
PRODUCER: Eryk Rocha, Gabriela Carneiro Da Cunha
SCREENPLAY: Eryk Rocha, Gabriela Carneiro Da Cunha
CAST: Davi Kopenawa, Justino Yanomami, Givaldo Yanomami
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Until the early 1970s, the indigenous Yanomami and Watoriki Amazonian tribes lived in relative isolation. However, during Brazil's military dictatorship, a highway was built across their territory, devastating the landscape and opening it up to resource extraction companies. Narrated by Yanomami shaman and leader Davi Kopenawa, this breathtaking documentary traces his indigenous amazonian community’s preparations for a time-worn funeral rite said to hold up the sky, a ceremony that also galvanises them in the battle to defend their homeland against illegal gold mining.
AWARDS: Best International Feature Documentary, Guanajuato International Film Festival 2024
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Cannes Film Festival 2024, Melbourne International Film Festival 2024
LINK TRAILER: The Falling Sky - Teaser Trailer Internazionale
TAGS: Ecology, Films by Women, Documentary, Social Impact

His acclaimed filmography includes: The Gun (from 6 to 7:30 p.m.) (2003), Ulybka Boga, ili Chisto odesskaya istoriya (2008) and Voyna Printsessy (2013).

The businessman incites selfish city officials to demolish the building of a boarding school for disabled children, where the heroine of the film, the silent girl Nastya, ends up. But the children categorically disagree with this and defend their home.

DIRECTOR BIO: Tapan Sinha is one of India's most prominent filmmakers, and one of the forerunners of the 'Parallel Cinema' movement. In his six-decade long career, he made films in Bengali, Hindi and Oriya languages, straddling genres from social realism, family drama, labor rights, to children's fantasy films. His most noted films include Kabuliwala (1957), Louha-Kapat, Sagina Mahato (1970), Apanjan (1968), Kshudhita Pashan and children's film Safed Haathi (1978) and Aaj Ka Robinhood (1987). Sinha is known for forming a legendary quartet with contemporary filmmakers such as Satyajit Ray, Ritwik Ghatak and Mrinal Sen.
SCREENPLAY: Premendra Mitra,Tapan Sinha, Rabindranath Tagore (author, Kabuliwala)
CAST: Chhabi Biswas, Oindrila Tagore, Radhamohan Bhattacharya
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: An Afghan fruit seller befriends a small Bengali girl in Calcutta because she reminds him of his daughter. He gets a letter notifying him of his daughter’s illness and decides to return, but kills a man in a dispute on the eve of his journey and spends the next ten years in jail. Adapted from a story by Rabindranath Tagore.
AWARDS:
Silver Bear, Berlin Intenational Film Festival 1957 | 
President's Gold Medal, National Film Awards 1957
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Berlin International Film Festival, 1957

Forced to beg for stale and rotten food every day, little Jotya has to make do with the smell of fresh food, something he has grown to cherish. While his pregnant mother struggles to make ends meet, Jotya becomes obsessed with a particular smell, a smell that will forever change his life.

DIRECTOR BIO: Naqqash Khalid is a writer, director and producer known for In Camera (2023).
CAST:
Nabhaan Rizwan, Amir El-Masry & Rory

LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: In Camera follows Aden, a young actor caught in a cycle of nightmarish auditions, facing rejection after rejection. Formally playful and fiercely charged, Khalid's debut about a struggling British Asian actor confronts film industry prejudice and social hypocricsy head-on.

DIRECTOR BIO: Amrou Al-Kadhi is a British-Iraqi writer, drag performer, and filmmaker whose work primarily focuses on queer identity, cultural representation and racial politics. Al-Kadhi made a cameo appearance in the 2021 Sony's Spider-Man Universe (SSU) film Venom: Let There Be Carnage as a temporary host of the title character. Layla is is feature debut.
CAST: Bilal Hasna, Louis Greatorex, Safiyya Ingar, Terique Jarrett and Sarah Agha
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Layla is a struggling Arab drag queen who hides their insecurities behind a radical facade. Performing at a corporate Pride party, they catch the eye of Max, a successful white gay man whose attention sweeps Layla off their feet. The two start an intoxicating romance, but as Layla starts to alter who they are in order to keep Max’s affections, they both have to face uncomfortable truths.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Sundance Film Festival 2024, BFI Flare 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Christopher Andrews is a UK-based writer-director. He’s directed the short films Fire (2015) and Stalker (2018), and has written scripts for the upcoming films Cavendish and an adaptation of the Booker-winner Frankenstein in Baghdad.
PRODUCER: Ivana MacKinnon, Jacob Swan Hyam, Ruth Treacy, Julianne Forde, Jean-Yves Roubin, Cassandre Warnauts
CAST: Christopher Abbott, Barry Keoghan, Colm Meaney, Nora-Jane Noone, Paul Ready, Aaron Heffernan
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Michael, the last son of a shepherding family, lives with his ailing father, Ray. When a conflict with rival farmer Gary and his son Jack escalates, a devastating chain of events leaves both families permanently altered.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Toronto International Film Festival 2024, BFI London Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Peter Greenaway is a British film director, editor, screenwriter and a visual artist. He has produced a wealth of short and feature-length films, but also paintings, novels and other books. A trained painter, he has held several one-man shows and curated exhibitions at museums world-wide. His films are characterised by a an overpowering visual aspect and his recurring interest in Renaissance, Baroque and Flemish art. Most notable among them: The Cook, the Thief, His Wife & Her Lover (1989), A Zed & Two Noughts (1985), The Draughtsman's Contract (1982), and Rembrandt's J'Accuse (2008),
CAST: Anthony Higgins, Janet Suzman, Anne Louise Lambert
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Set in rural Wiltshire in 1694, Greenaway’s breakthrough feature has an arrogant young artist insisting on payment in sexual favours when a woman commissions him to paint a series of pictures of her family’s house and grounds. But things are not as they may seem… Acerbic dialogue, flamboyant costumes, crisp compositions and, above all, Michael Nyman’s Purcell-based score make for intriguingly intelligent entertainment.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Venice Film Festival 1982, Chicago International Film Festival 1982

DIRECTOR BIO: Moin is a London based writer and director. His short films have screened in competition at festivals around the world, including Cannes Semaine De La Critique, Sitges, BFI London Film Festival and Edinburgh International Film Festival. He has been named as one of Screen International’s ‘Stars of Tomorrow’. Sky Peals is his debut feature.
CAST: Faraz Ayub, Natalie Gavin, Claire Rushbrook, Simon Nagra, Steve Oram, Jeff Mirza, Bill Fellows
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Adam works nightshifts at a motorway service station and lives a small and lonely life. Upon hearing that his estranged father has died, he finds himself in search of answers. Piecing together a complicated image of a man he never knew, Adam starts to become convinced he descends from an alien race.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Venice Film Festival 2023, London Film Festival 2023

DIRECTOR BIO: Narine Mkrtchyan was born in 1960 in Yerevan, USSR [now Armenia]. She is a director and writer known for Bobo (1991), Radio Yerevan (1992), and Anarak vordu veradardz (2008). Arsen Azatian is an Armenian filmmaker, best known for films like Radio Yerevan (1993), The Return of The Prodigal Son (2008), and The Glass Trinket (2012).
CAST: Sergey Parajanov, Albert Yavuryan, Nariné Mkrtchyan, Arsen Azatyan, Alena Varjapetyan
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Bobo is dedicated to the renowned Armenian filmmaker Sergei Parajanov, to the unfolding memory of a man who was variously referred to as a genius, a mime, a tradesman, and a saint. Chronicling Parajanov's final days, the film altogether breaks away from film genres and logical plot points, and instead becomes a psychoanalysis of the nether-world essence of the great master, a search for other dimensions about which we dare not even sometimes speculate.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Berlin International Film Festival 1992

DIRECTOR BIO: Robert Bresson is one of the most revered and pivotal of French filmmakers. His films are infused with spiritual themes, often attempting to examine issues of redemption and salvation, and how the individual’s place in the broader society may affect the possibility of achieving either state. While his films are undeniably serious and frequently challenging, Bresson’s oeuvre is undeniably one of the most sublime in cinema history.
CAST: Isabelle Weingarten, Guillaume des Forêts, Jean-Maurice Monnoyer, Lidia Biondi
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Perhaps Robert Bresson’s most underrated film, Four Nights of a Dreamer finds the ascetic master again adapting Fyodor Dostoevsky, here transposing the short story “White Nights” to contemporary Paris. Four Nights of a Dreamer captures a series of meetings across consecutive nights between Jacques and Marthe. Surrounded by the still-smoldering remains of May ’68, the two open their hearts to each other, conjuring the majesty and mystery of human connection, at once obscure and clarifying, direct and ambiguous.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Berlin International Film Festival 1971, Cannes Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Widely lauded in his native Japan, director Shinji Somai remains largely unrecognized in the West. A pioneering filmmaker during what is sometimes referred to as the “lost decade” of Japanese cinema, Somai came to prominence during the 1980s, and directed some of the era’s most original and enduring works.
CAST: Kiichi Nakai, Junko Sakurada, Tomoko Tabata, Tsurube Shofukutei
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Based on a novel of the same name by Hiko Tanaka, Moving centres on precocious fifth grader, Renko (deftly played by Tomoko Tabata in her first role), who is grappling with the separation of her parents. Faced with the possibility of never seeing her father again and being subjected to a future she did not design, Renko becomes an irrepressible force, stopping at nothing to bring her parents back together. Uniquely situated from the perspective of a child, the film thrums with an intensity that builds to a transcendent third act and expands Somai’s prized oeuvre of films detailing rebellious youth
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Cannes Film Festival 1993, Toronto International Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: At the age of 24, Nicolas Winding Refn wrote and directed the extremely violent and uncompromising Pusher (1996), which soon became a cult hit. His subsequent films include Bleeder (1999), Pusher II (2004) and Pusher III (2005), and Valhalla Rising (2009) the latter of which led the world media to define NWR’s filmic style as “Refn-esk.”
CAST: Kim Bodnia, Mads Mikkelsen, Zlatko Buric
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Frank, a small-time drug dealer, faces the worst week of his life when a heroin deal turns sour, leaving him indebted to Balkan drug baron, Milo. As the week progresses, Frank struggles to repay the money amidst mounting pressure from the merciless drug lord. His rising desperation spirals out of control when nothing goes as planned, forcing Frank to confront the dire consequences of his own self-inflicted plight.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Cannes Film Festival 1993, Venice International Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Widely lauded in his native Japan, director Shinji Somai remains largely unrecognized in the West. A pioneering filmmaker during what is sometimes referred to as the “lost decade” of Japanese cinema, Somai came to prominence during the 1980s, and directed some of the era’s most original and enduring works.
CAST: Rentarô Mikuni, Chikage Awashima, Akira Emoto
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: During the summer holidays, three young adventurous schoolboys have fun spying on an eccentric old man who lives alone in a secluded house. Gradually, they get closer and discover an extraordinary man. From the acclaimed director of Moving and Typhoon Club comes an enchanting and heartwarming coming-of-age tale.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Hong Kong International Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Dadasaheb Phalke was an Indian producer, director, and screenwriter, popularly known as the Father of Indian cinema. His debut film, Raja Harishchandra, was the first Indian movie released in 1913, and is now known as India's first full-length feature film. He made 94 feature-length films and 27 short films in his career. Some of his most noted works include: Mohini Bhasmasur (1913), Satyavan Savitri (1914), Lanka Dahan (1917), Shri Krishna Janma (1918) and Kaliya Mardan (1919).
CAST: Neelkanth, Mandakini Phalke
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Featuring adventurous and comic episodes from the life of Krishna, played by Mandakini Phalke, the film features the famed special effects skills of the pioneering figure, Dadasaheb Phalke. The screening of the surviving fragments of the film will be accompanied by live music by the ensemble, Borno Anonyo.

DIRECTOR BIO: Raj Kapoor was an Indian actor, film director and producer, who worked in Hindi cinema. He is considered one of the greatest and most influential actors and filmmakers in the history of Indian cinema, and has been referred to as the Charlie Chaplin of Indian Cinema. His performance in Awaara was ranked as one of the "Top-Ten Greatest Performances of All Time in World Cinema" by Time magazine in 2005.
CAST: Raj Kappor, Nargis, Prithviraj Kapoor, Leela Chitnis
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: To celebrate the birth centenary of one of the most important figures of Indian cinema, Raj Kapoor, we showcase the sprawling modern epic of Awara, in which the archetypal figure of Raj (Kapoor) explores questions about wealth, power and destiny.

DIRECTOR BIO: Actor, producer, and film director, Amarjeet is known for producing films like Teen Devian (1965), Duniya (1968), Prem Shastra (1974) and Rocky (1981), as well as directing films like Gambler (1971), Teen Devian (1965), and Hum Dono (1961). He is famous for his multiple collaborations with the actor Dev Anand.
CAST: Dev Anand, Nanda, Sadhana
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Set against the backdrop of the second World War, the film features Dev Anand in a double role as a soldier who takes on the identity of a fellow army mate. Featuring a soundtrack by Jiadev, the film is being screened to honour the birth centenary of one of the most important voices of Indian cinema, Mohammed Rafi.

DIRECTOR BIO: Tapan Sinha was one of the prominent members of the Parallel Cinema Movement, forming a legendary quartet with Satyajit Ray, Ritwik Ghatak and Mrinal Sen. He was primarily a Bengali filmmaker who worked both in Hindi cinema and Bengali cinema, directing films like Kabuliwala (1957), Louha-Kapat, Sagina Mahato (1970), Apanjan (1968), Kshudhita Pashan and children's films like Safed Haathi (1978) and Aaj Ka Robinhood.
CAST: Arundhati Devi, Anil Chatterjee, Kali Bannerjee,
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: A harmonium becomes the cause of mishap and tragedy as it changes hands from its original owner, a down-and-out princess (Arundhati Devi). The film is being showcased to mark the centenary celebrations of the filmmaker extraordinaire, Tapan Sinha, who also composed the music of the film.

DIRECTOR BIO: Vedantam Raghavayya was an Indian film director, dance choreographer, and actor known for his work in Telugu and Tamil cinema. He went on to direct many notable films, including Devadasu (1953), Annadata (1954), Anarkali (1955), Prema Pasam (1956), Bhale Ramudu (1956), Chiranjeevulu (1956), Suvarna Sundari (1957), and Rahasyam (1967). An accomplished Kuchipudi dancer, he was honoured with the title "Bharata Kala Prapurna" by the Andhra Pradesh government in recognition of his expertise.
CAST: Akkineni Nageswara Rao, Savitri, Lalitha
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: In this adaptation of the Bengali classic, Akkineni Nageswara Rao takes on the role of the doomed hero Devdas accompanied by Savitri and Lalitha as Paro and Chandramukhi. The film marks the centenary celebrations of the matinee idol ANR, whose influence on Indian cinema resounds to the day.

DIRECTOR BIO: Satyajit Ray was an Indian film director, screenwriter, author, lyricist, magazine editor, illustrator, calligrapher, and composer. Ray is widely considered one of the greatest and most influential film directors in the history of cinema. Ray received many major awards in his career, including a record thirty-seven Indian National Film Awards, a Golden Lion, a Golden Bear, two Silver Bears, many additional awards at international film festivals and ceremonies, and an Academy Honorary Award in 1992.
SCREENPLAY: Satyajit Ray (based on a novel by Sankar)
CAST: Barun Chanda, Harindranath Chattopadhyay, Sharmila Tagore, Paromita Chowdhury
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: By exploring the dizzying success of an ambitious sales manager (Barun Chanda) and his interactions with his principled sister-in-law (Sharmila Tagore), Ray's film, part of his Calcutta trilogy, presents a strong indictment of corporate ruthlessness.

DIRECTOR BIO: Khwaja Ahmad Abbas was an Indian film director, screenwriter, novelist, and journalist in Urdu, Hindi and English. As a director and screenwriter, he is considered one of the pioneers of Indian neo-realist cinema. Internationally, his films have won the Palme d'Or (Golden Palm Grand Prize) at Cannes Film Festival and the Crystal Globe at Karlovy Vary International Film Festival.
CAST: Madhavan Nair, Utpal Dutt, Jalal Agha, Anwar Ali, Amitabh Bachchan, Shehnaz
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: In this rousing account, a dying woman (Shahnaz) assembles a group of individuals from different communities and parts of the country to raise resistance against the Portuguese rule of Goa. The film featured Madhu, Utpal Dutt, Amitabh Bachchan, Jalal Agha, Anwar Ali and Madhukar in the roles of the brave ensemble.

DIRECTOR BIO: An award-winning and multi-disciplinary Kiwi-Australian director-designer, Marcelle Lunam is listed among the Australian Masters of Motion. Her awards include; Best Film, Byron Bay International Film Festival; Rolling Stone Critic’s Choice Best Director; and a nomination for Australia’s 100 Spirited Women in New Woman Magazine. She has also taught film, animation, design, interactive media, high-end production and emerging tech at AIT, Sydney.
PRODUCER: Bruna Papandrea, Steve Hutensky, Jodi Matterson, Cristina Pozzan
CAST: Teresa Palmer, Joe Dempsie, Eamon Farren, Adrienne Pickering, Sarah Peirse, Lou Baxter, Zahra Newman
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH:
Grace Lisa Vandenburg counts everything because numbers hold
her world together, but when a chance encounter with Seamus turns her
world upside down, Grace’s meticulously ordered life starts to unravel.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Toronto International Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Robert Connolly is one of Australia’s most acclaimed and best-known filmmakers with an international career spanning 30 years. He directed and produced Paper Planes (2014), The Dry (2020), Blueback (2022), among others, and has received numerous accolades. He was also one of the directors for the Emmy-nominated The Slap (2011) and recently completed Deep State (2019) for Fox Network Group. In 2001, he received a Centenary Medal for services to the Australian Film Industry.
PRODUCER: Bruna Papandrea, Steve Hutensky, Jodi Matterson, Eric Bana, Robert Connolly
CAST: Eric Bana, Jacqueline McKenzie, Anna Torv, Deborra-lee Furness, Robin McLeavy, Sisi Stringer, Lucy Ansell, Jeremy Lindsay-Taylor, Richard Roxburgh, Tony Briggs, Kenneth Radley
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Five women head out into a remote wilderness on an executive retreat. Several days later, only four return. Federal Police Agent Aaron Falk has a keen interest in the whereabouts of the missing hiker. As he desperately searches for the missing woman and the truth about what happened out there, fragmented memories from his childhood in the same remote landscape fight their way to the surface.

DIRECTOR BIO: Independent filmmakers in their own right, Will Howarth and Tom McKeith have a longstanding partnership which began in highschool. Their feature debut Beast, premiered at the Toronto International Film Festival in 2015. In Vitro is their second film together.
PRODUCER: Lisa Shaunessy, Bec Janek, William Howarth, Rachael Fung
SCREENPLAY: Tom McKeith, William Howarth, Talia Zucker
CAST: Talia Zucker, Ashley Zukerman, Will Howarth
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Layla and her husband Jack live on an isolated cattle property hundreds of miles from the nearest neighbour. With their son away at boarding school, Jack spends his days tending to the livestock and experimenting with new biotechnology, Layla pines for her son and the life she once had. But one night, everything changes, when a storm knocks out power to the property and they soon discover that something unknown has been released onto the farm.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Sydney Film Festival 2024, Melbourne International Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: John Sheedy is a multi-award-winning film, television and theatre director, writer, and producer. His select works includes: the short Mrs McCutcheon (2017, Best Director, Australian Directors Guild Awards), the feature H Is For Happiness (2019, Special Jury Prize, Berlinale), and the series In Our Blood (2023, Nominee, Best Mini-Series, Best Actor, AACTA Awards). He has held the postion of Artistic Director at Barking Gecko Theatre Company, Australia's locally cherished company which produces plays for children and their families.
CAST: Jai Courtney, Lily LaTorre, Deborah Mailman, Jack Thompson, Genevieve Lemon, Celeste Barber, Jack La Torre, Matt Day, Tom Budge
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: A heartfelt and hilarious tale of eleven-year-old Annie Shearer and her best friend Runt, an adopted stray dog with remarkable abilities. In a bid to save their family farm, the two aspire to compete at the prestigious Krumpets Dog Show in London, whilst overcoming hurdles, obstacles and nefarious villains.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Melbourne International Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Jon Bell is one of the most experienced Indigenous Screenwriters in Australia. His feature horror-film, The Moogai is his first feature. His television credits include Cleverman (2017, Best Drama, Screen Producers Australia Award; Nominee, Best Television Series, AACTA); Ready For This (2015, Nominee, International Emmy Kids Award; Best Children’s Television Series, AACTA).

LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: A young mother is terrorised by an evil spirit intent on taking her children and must protect them at any cost.
AWARDS: Audience Award, Sydney Film Festival 2024
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Sundance Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Mark Leonard Winter is an Australian actor, writer and filmmaker gaining recognition for his performances in film, television and on stage. The Rooster is his first feature film.
CAST: Phoenix Raei, Hugo Weaving Ao

Adam Kamien is an Australian actor, director and writer. 
Luke Rynderman is an Australian screenwriter and director, with a passion for storytelling based in true events. This is the director-duo's first project.

LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: A true-crime docu-drama based on the unsolved murders that claimed the lives of four teens working in a burger restaurant in 1978.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Adelaide Film Festival 2023

DIRECTOR BIO: Payal Kapadia is a Mumbai based filmmaker. She studied Film Direction at the Film & Television Institute of India. Her short films Afternoon Clouds (2017) and And What Is The Summer Saying (2018) premiered respectively at the Cinéfondation and the Berlinale. Her first feature film A Night of Knowing Nothing (2021) premiered at Cannes, Director’s Fortnight, where it won the Golden Eye for Best Documentary. Her Filmograohy includes - All We Imagine As Light, Cannes Official Competition 2024; A Night of Knowing Nothing (2021) Cannes Director’s Fortnight, Oeil d’Or for Best Documentary; and And What Is The Summer Saying (short, documentary) (2018).
CAST: Kani Kusruti, Divya Prabha, Chhaya Kadam, Hridhu Haroon, Azees Nedumangad
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: In Mumbai, Nurse Prabha’s routine is troubled when she receives an unexpected gift from her estranged husband. Her younger roommate, Anu, tries in vain to find a spot in the city to be intimate with her boyfriend. A trip to a beach town allows them to find a space for their desires to manifest.
AWARDS: Grand Prix, Cannes Film Festival 2024 | RTVE Another Look Award, San Sebastián International Film Festival 2024
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Cannes Film Festival 2024, Toronto International Film Festival 2024, San Sebastián International Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Pedro Almodóvar is an acclaimed filmmaker, screenwriter and author, and one of the most celebrated Spanish filmmakers internationally. His many directorial credits include the Festival selections Women on the Verge of a Nervous Breakdown (1988), Talk to Her (2002), Bad Education (2004), Volver (2006), Broken Embraces (2009), Julieta (2016), and Pain and Glory (2019). His many accolades include Academy Awards, BAFTA Awards, Emmy Awards, and Golden Globes. He is also the receipient of the French Legion of Honour (1997), and the Golden Lion for Lifetime Achievement (2019). The Room Next Door (2024) is his latest film, and his first English language film.
CAST: Tilda Swinton, Julianne Moore, John Turturro, Alessandro Nivola, Juan Diego Botto, Raúl Arévalo, Victoria Luengo, Alex Hogh Andersen, Esther McGregor, Alvise Rigo, Melina Matthews
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Ingrid and Martha were close friends in their youth, when they worked together at the same magazine. Ingrid went on to become an autofiction novelist while Martha became a war reporter. Eventually, they were separated by the circumstances of life. After years of being out of touch, they meet again in an extreme but strangely sweet situation.
AWARDS: Golden Lion (Best Film), Brian Award, Venice Film Festival 2024
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Venice Film Festival 2024. Toronto International Film Festival 2024, San Sebastián International Film Festival 2024, BFI London Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Federico Cecchetti is originally from Mexico City. He graduated from the University Center for Cinematographic Studies (CUEC) at UNAM. He also studied at the Centro Sperimentale di Cinematografia in Rome, Italy. To date, he has directed eight short films, including El maléfico Dr. Machete (2005), Raíces (2007), and Transhumantes (2009), for which he received an Ariel Award nomination in the category of Best Fiction Short Film. His first feature film is the aforementioned El sueño de Mara’akame, which won the Eye Award for Best First or Second Mexican Feature Film at the Morelia International Film Festival (FICM).

DIRECTOR BIO: Mai Thu Huyen is a famous director, producer, actress and entrepreneur in Vietnam. She is the founder & CEO of Tincom Media Company. She has been working in the film industry for nearly 30 years, and is the recipient of many awards.

DIRECTOR BIO: Michael Gracey is an Australian visual effects artist and filmmaker. He is best known for directing the great American musical biography The Greatest Showman (2017) starring Hugh Jackman, Zac Efron and Zendaya. He followed this feat by joining as Executive Producer on Elton John's biopic Rocketman (2019). He is known for his exceptional background in VFX and a fluency in music production, that has consistently brought a fresh - often viral - approach to his projects that seizes the audience's imagination.

Paul Currie,
Michael Gracey,
Coco Xiaolu Ma,
Craig McMahon,

LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: In this musical biography of British pop legend Robbie Williams, Williams is played—with startling vitality—by none other than Williams himself! Uniquely told from Robbie's perspective, the film captures his signature wit and indomitable spirit. It follows Robbie's journey from childhood, to being the youngest member of chart-topping boyband Take That, through to his unparalleled achievements as a record-breaking solo artist -- all the while confronting the challenges that stratospheric fame and success can bring.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Telluride Film Festival 2024, Toronto International Film Festival 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Bohdan Sláma studied film direction at Prague’s FAMU, and is one of the most highly-regarded Czech filmmakers working today. Deeply influenced by Czech New Wave cinema, he is best known for his tragicomedies rooted in realism and humanism. His feature debut, Wild Bees (DIVOKÉ VCELY), the portrait of a Moravian village and its quirky inhabitants, won the 2002 VPRO Tiger Award for best film at Rotterdam, and was also Czech Republic's official Oscar entry. Four years later, he made Something Like Happiness (STESTÍ), which won the 2005 Golden Shell at San Sebastián and the Czech Lion for Best Director. In 2009, Variety Magazine named him as one of "10 Directors to Watch Out For". Dry Season is his eighth feature film.
PRODUCER: Pavel Strnad, Petr Oukropec, Marko Škop, Ján Meliš
CAST: Dorota Šlajerová, Tomas Sean Pšenička, Magdaléna Borová, Martin Pechlát, Marek Daniel
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: A bucolic Czech village. Verdant fields surround a small farm where fifty-year-old Josef lives with his wife Eva and three children. Josef attempts to live an alternative life, leading a Don Quixote-like struggle against the local agribusiness owned by Viktor, for whom the land is just a tool for profit. Victor in turn shares a turbulent relationship with his recently returned son, a Gen-Z climate activist. As the dry summer reaches its peak, the village runs out of drinking water, leading to escalating tensions between the two families, and also between two divergent ways of living and being.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Galway Film Fleadh 2024

DIRECTOR BIO: Ashutosh Gowariker is an Indian film director, actor, screenwriter and producer. He is known for directing large scale, opulent epics as well as grounded, realistic dramas. His work includes the acclaimed films , Jodhaa Akbar (2008), Swades (2004), and Lagaan (2001), the latter of which was India's official Oscar submission for the Best Foreign Language Film award.
SCREENPLAY: Ashutosh Gowariker, Ayan Mukerji, Sameer Sharma, Lalit Marathe, Amin Hajee, Charlotte Whitby – Coles, Yashdeep Nigudkar
CAST: Shah Rukh Khan, Gayatri Joshi, Kishori Ballal
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Mohan, an Indian expatriate employed with NASA, travels to his country to track down his beloved nanny, Kaveri. His journey takes him to the village of Charanpur in the heart of rural India, and sets him on both an outward and inner quest to find out where he truly belongs.

DIRECTOR BIO: Todd Haynes is an American screenwriter and director known for films that examine fame, sexuality, and the lives of people on the periphery of mainstream society. His notable movies include Safe (1995), Velvet Goldmine (1998), Far from Heaven (2002), I’m Not There (2007), Carol (2015), and May December (2023).
PRODUCER: Elizabeth Karlsen, Stephen Woolley, Christine Vachon
CAST: Cate Blanchett, Rooney Mara, Kyle Chandler
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: In New York in the early 1950s, Therese Belivet, is working in a Manhattan department store and dreaming of a more fulfilling life when she meets Carol Aird, an alluring woman trapped in a failing marriage. An immediate connection sparks between them. When Carol’s involvement with Therese comes to light, Carol’s husband retaliates by challenging her competence as a mother. And as Carol and Therese take refuge on the road, leaving their respective lives behind, a confrontation emerges that will test each woman’s assumptions about herself and commitments to one another.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Cannes Film Festival 2015

DIRECTOR BIO: Baz Luhrmann is an Australian writer, director and producer,. As a storyteller, he 's known as a pioneer of pop culture, fusing high and low culture with a unique sonic and cinematic language. He is the most commercially successful Australian director, with his films making up four of the top ten highest worldwide grossing Australian films ever. His filmography includes films like Romeo + Juliet (1996), Moulin Rouge! (2001), and The Great Gatsby (2013).
CAST: Nicole Kidman, Ewan McGregor, John Leguizamo
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: Moulin Rouge is a celebration of truth, beauty, freedom but above all things love. Set in the infamous, gaudy and glamorous Paris nightclub, circa 1900. Director Baz Luhrmann brings together gorgeous period design and modern-era pop tunes to create a unique comic/tragic motion picture experience. Nicole Kidman portrays Satine, the Sparkling Diamond, star of the Moulin Rouge and the city’s most famous courtesan. Satine is caught between the love of a young writer and another man’s obsession. Ewan McGregor is the writer, Christian, who finds himself plunged into this decadent world where anything goes, except falling in love.

DIRECTOR BIO:
Daniel Roher is a filmmaker from Toronto, Canada. His film Navalny won Sundance’s 2022 Festival Favorite Award, the BAFTA Award for Best Documentary, as well as the Academy Award for Best Documentary Feature.
Edmund Stenson’s work as director, producer and editor spans both documentary and fiction and focuses on social issues, loners and nomads. He has cut award-winning documentary features, shorts and television series in English, French and Japanese.
LONG SYNOPSIS ENGLISH: When three of their four children are diagnosed with retinitis pigmentosa, a rare and incurable disease that leads to severe visual impairment, the Pelletier family’s world changes forever. In the face of this life-altering news, Edith Lemay, Sébastien Pelletier and their children set out on a trip around the world to experience all its beauty while they still can. As they fill their memories with breathtaking destinations and once-in-a-lifetime encounters, the family’s love, resilience and unshakeable sense of wonder ensure that their uncertain future does not define their present.
FESTIVAL HISTORY: Telluride Film Festival 2024
